column1: Vonage Root certificate update
column35:
As discussed in IT standup yesterday by [~accountid:557058:8dbea354-e1ba-4c49-86d1-3292906cd85e], devops need to check vonage root certificate update which  expires soon.

# Find solution before expiry
# Find Impact area
# Risk assessment

Please make sure If you are raising anything to support, please update Jira for everyone to trace
column503:
29/Oct/24 12:19 PM;712020:f57f118c-1548-4679-a91b-e0f1f6725fbc;[~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] After a thorough review and testing of our environment, we have confirmed that we are already using the trusted certificate.

Following the guidance provided by the Vonage support team, we conducted a cURL test on the toolbox production pod to validate the trust level of the G2 root certificate. The test, based on their specified commands and the resulting server response, confirmed that the certificate is indeed trusted.
For your reference, all relevant details are available in the attached screenshot.

column1: Laura james have raised some issues with Mintsoft Labels
column35:
BJS labels  generated in MS (Mintsoft- our WMS system) are not being accepted  by BJS- hence  the team  requests  them; we do not  know  exactly  the reason why and I  do not know if  anyone  from BJS has  signed off the BJS shipment labels produced by MS; if  you can point me in the right direction and  explain  what must be fixed  so  the labels generated  by our warehouse management  system- MS  can be  applied?

 

Below  is  the  comparison  of the labels  populated  in MS against  the labels  sent  by BJS

 

* Labels  populated in MS  display  different  weights – total weight of the SO divided  by the  amount of shipment labels  whereas  BJS labels display  the weight per  SKU carton
* BJS labels  display  customer’s  name  but the labels produced  by MS  do  not  include that info
* BJS labels  have depot info  whereas  labels produced by MS  do not include  any  depot details
* BJS labels  have barcode   with  corresponding SO  whereas  the labels produced  by MS  have only  one barcode  with the tracking details
* BJS labels do not display CBM but the labels generated by MS have this info  on the shipment labels
* BJS labels have  displayed “BJS HOME DELIVERY” whereas  the labels produced  by MS  do not include it

 

I have  found  only the above differences  and I have used below  to compare;  I hope  this helps  but if you require  anything else please  let me know?

 

BJS labels produced by MS



!BJS Label Produced by Mintsoft.png|width=83.33333333333334%,alt="BJS Label Produced by Mintsoft.png"!

BJS labels  sent by BJS



!BJS labels  sent by BJS.png|width=83.33333333333334%,alt="BJS labels  sent by BJS.png"!

  [ BJS Label Produced by Mintsoft.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/59822  ] - 123808 Bytes - Gurparsaad Singh - 2024-10-28 
  [ BJS labels  sent by BJS.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/59823  ] - 205228 Bytes - Gurparsaad Singh - 2024-10-28

column1: Contact Details not uploading on Irish Orders
column35:
Example; B7490152-9308 / T12W 62K
Manifest has contact details, when uploaded onto the system, contact details haven't uploaded, only email address 
This is happening for a lot of Irish orders  

Attachments: 
  

  [ 2024-10-17 laura james direct.xlsx | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/59717  ] - 54268 Bytes - Orders Department - 2024-10-24
column502:
28/Oct/24 12:30 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Sanchit Aggarwal added:*
I have investigated this and as of now, it looks like that GSiT does not recognize Irish contact numbers, 

As i have checked, and the Manifests contains numbers of different types, 

# Number starting from 44…. *(GSiT recognizes UK country code, and then replace 44 with 0).*
# 10 digit number or 11 digit number initializing with 0 *(GSiT saves the contact number as it is passed.)*
# Irish Number which are starting from 353, *(These are the numbers which are not recognizable by GSiT as of now)* [~accountid:712020:a9570e03-4282-41d6-86b1-b12ef6c5998b] Can you please confirm if this point 3 was working earlier for the users?? If yes, can you try to get couple of order examples for same?


Thanks
column503:
28/Oct/24 1:00 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*manpreet kaur added:*
Hi [~accountid:6149eb1ecee20b0069d55f64] 
During the call with the user, it was confirmed that the issue pertains specifically to Irish numbers starting with the country codes 353 and 358. The user mentioned that they will provide additional examples within the next hour.
Thanks
column504:
28/Oct/24 1:22 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Vishal Rathore added:*
[~accountid:712020:a9570e03-4282-41d6-86b1-b12ef6c5998b] Just to clear we need example orders where it worked before with Irish numbers ?

column507:
28/Oct/24 2:20 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Sanchit Aggarwal added:*
[~accountid:712020:a9570e03-4282-41d6-86b1-b12ef6c5998b], i have checked the example orders provided by the user, where the functionality used to work before. 

And this is something which looks like that GSiT have implemented recently, where the GSiT system is not accepting the Irish Numbers, 
Now when trying to add Irish Number on GSiT, it now returns an error asking to add Valid UK number. 

So this needs to be raised to GSiT, as they have the remove this validation, so the user will be able to Add Irish numbers where required.

column1: SSO creating multiple user with same name
column35:
!image-20241021-133121.png|width=1638,height=472,alt="image-20241021-133121.png"! 

Attachments: 
  

  [ image-20241021-133121.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/59544  ] - 38849 Bytes - Prachi Sinha - 2024-10-21
column502:
21/Oct/24 1:35 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Prachi Sinha added:*
Hi [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496],
We have raised this issue on behalf of the service desk.
As per the last discussion, it was clear that SSO will not create duplicate users with the same username.

Kindly find the attachment for reference, and let me know if any further info is required.

FYI [~accountid:632979a514c6b4b2210a46f2]  [~accountid:623c40424a57610068e76558] 

Kind regards,
Prachi
column503:
29/Oct/24 9:03 AM;63e0de798978d7a4353c0021;Hi [~accountid:712020:686434c8-5766-4071-b00c-da0e96f295a9] [~accountid:632979a514c6b4b2210a46f2] 

!image-20241029-090235.png|width=1257,height=423,alt="image-20241029-090235.png"!

Facing permission issue to view the attachment.
FYI [~accountid:62beceeff53d91673869f19a]
column504:
29/Oct/24 11:41 AM;632979a514c6b4b2210a46f2;Hi [~accountid:63e0de798978d7a4353c0021],
Find the attachment

!image-20241021-133121.png|width=1638,height=472,alt="image-20241021-133121.png"!

Thanks
column505:
30/Oct/24 7:40 AM;63e0de798978d7a4353c0021;Hi [~accountid:632979a514c6b4b2210a46f2] [~accountid:712020:686434c8-5766-4071-b00c-da0e96f295a9] 
SSO system is designed not to create duplicate users with the same username. However, in the attached case, there is a difference in the usernames—one is {{deshantk}} and the other is {{deshantK}}. Due to this variation in capitalization, the system treats them as distinct usernames, which is why two separate accounts were created.
FYI [~accountid:62beceeff53d91673869f19a] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]

If the issue still exists, then can you please ask the reporter for the device info? like device name which was registered on epod.
column504:
23/Oct/24 11:47 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Sanchit Aggarwal added:*
Have investigated the device TR-007 on EPOD, and found out that the incorrect contact number was updated on EPOD for the mentioned device by someone, 

Due to which different numbers were available for same device on epod and GSiT, and it caused mis-linking of data. 

I have updated the contact number on EPOD, to the number which is available on GSiT, and the linking for the device is established again. 

[~accountid:5da5b2e0f273020c44680624] Can you please check the TR-007 device again and confirm if you are able to scan the route now?

Thanks

column1: Dusk have asked for a change to the scanning information within toolbox
column35:
Hi Gurparsaad,





 

We are using your scanners to manifest stock into Toolbox app.

Due to increased discrepancies recently reported we are building our validation master sheet.

 

The issue I see now is that the toolbox shows the times of release, not scan to trailer timestamps. The time between scan and release varies—it can be a few minutes or a few hours, as below. This makes controlling the whole process much more difficult for the despatch team. Would it be possible to give us visibility to those?

 

Possibility to filter out only scanned items would be helpful as well.

 

Please see below an example of values I am talking about:

!Toolbox Scanning 1.png|width=100%,alt="Toolbox Scanning 1.png"!

!Toolbox Scanning 2.png|width=384,height=212,alt="Toolbox Scanning 2.png"!

If you require additional information please let me know.

column502:
22/Oct/24 12:24 PM;63b5392f6f068efec8f81bae;Hello [~accountid:624ae9382e101c006a90abcb] 
I have looked up to this issue and after hours of debugging . I found that in this slide user has simply copy paste all the content of the slide as photograpgh . So basically it is an image, rather than it should be combination of text and image. You can also cross check this if you try to edit this whole slide then you’ll find a single image which comprises of this colorful text.

[~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] Also considering when the user is inserting a full image then also the crop thing should not happen. To debug this I take two reference and added two slides , in first I capture full image and paste it as it is and in second slide I pasted the same picture and then cropped it little and then took back to its original size.
Then I downloaded the whole induction and in the PDF first newky created slide in which I pasted the picture as it is, it got cropped, and in the second approach it got clear. Please take a look at the video attached or let me know if this sounds more clarification.
So yeah issue is their with images. So to tackle this I have done my researches and found that right now we are using Free version of *JODIT EDITOR* which is our main content body where we generally create or update slide content. So this free version limits some usage therefore we might need a pro version of it. 

More over benefits of the pro version will be that user can drag or browse through their file system to upload images rather than taking screenshots and then pasting which so convenient. Also with the pro version slide content can be created with color palates like right now we can't change color of the heading text which is included in the Pro version only.
Thankyou

[^screen-capture.webm]

FYI [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]

column1: Click-to-dial on GSiT to be made compatible with Zoom Phone
column35:
To fully rollout and support the implementation of Zoom phone, we require the numbers on BJS platforms to support the ‘[tel:’|tel:’] protocol - once the number is clicked, it will open the default calling (VoIP) software application on the user’s computer (the will be configured to Zoom phone).

This ticket solely relates to GSiT because this is what I know is used on a daily-basis by multiple departments. But additional click-to-dial functionality may be needed for EPOD etc. 

On GSIT we use the VOIP option on the 2 places. 

# On the Routes page.

# On the Order page.

The Route page options are required by most of the departments (DH, CXI, DCI) to reach out to the driver number. 

The Order page is used only for CSI, CCI departments to reach out to the customer. 

*No permissions should be required for this to work, it should simply* *_just work_**. Let’s not try to over-complicate this.*


See below required implementation:

[https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0067257|https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0067257|smart-link] 

h3. Using click-to-dial

!https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/office-365/outlook/generic/hover-phone-number-example.png|width=290,height=100!

# Click on a phone number located in a program that supports hyperlinks like Microsoft Office. The phone number must be properly tagged with the callto or tel protocols. Usually, you can hover the phone number to see if it's tagged.
# If prompted, select Zoom Meetings and select *Always use this app*.
# Click *OK*.
Zoom Phone will dial the selected number.
# Click the phone icon to call the number. Learn more about [making and receiving phone calls using Zoom Phone|https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0064854].
column55: Understand the zoom click to dial docs and implemented on local project of dms;28/Oct/24 11:11 AM;633afd71409249995eeb9038;9000
column502:
14/Oct/24 2:19 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Kyle Mather added:*

column1: Trolleys
column35:
scanning asset's such as trolley's which we did before on the system to allow us to audit the life cycle of the asset. dicussed with manpreet 

Attachments: 



21/10/2024: 


*Requirement Description:* The requirement is to add Asset (Trolley) Tracking via barcode, Scanning, and Asset Lifecycle Tracking functionalities to the existing Fleet Assets page.

*Functional Requirements:*

Asset Entry and Barcode: Toolbox Dashboard

 

* We have Fleet Assets list on toolbox where we can add trolley and automatically barcode are generated, we can select and generate barcode to apply on trolley.

Scanning:

* Require this for Inbound and Outbound flow for loading/offloading.
* When loading onto a route - once the load session is marked as complete, a prompt should appear to ask if there is a    trolley on this route. If yes, they will need to scan the barcode of the trolley. If they select no, then proceed to their next task.
*  When offloading, the system should try to perceive this as a product that needs to be scanned back in at the point of offloading, so it appears on the offloading list as well.
If there is a trolley then we can do the following:
** Offloading done
** Finish selected - when they do this, if trolley was loaded on this route in the morning then it doesn’t need to ask if trolley on route. It should just ask for the scan for trolley and if they advise not here then need this highlighting some way.

Tracking Asset Movement via Barcode Scanning:

* Upon scanning, the system will automatically update the “Current Location” and “Location Updated At” fields for the asset in the Fleet Assets table.

 

Asset Lifecycle Tracking and Updates:

 

* As assets are scanned and moved, the system will log all interactions and automatically update their lifecycle status (total duration since the asset is added to the list). This data is displayed in the same Fleet Assets table under a new Lifecycle column.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

# Asset movements are logged, and the location is updated upon scanning the barcode in scanner.
# Lifecycle status is calculated and updated automatically for each asset.

 

*Benefits*

# Enhanced tracking of asset movements and lifecycle providing cost analysis.
# Improved accuracy in logging asset status and usage.
# Improved accountability and operational efficiency
# Data accuracy and enhanced reporting



*Please Note:* As mentioned in the BA’s Flow document regarding the scanner action for “Offloading”, it shows the trolley at the end of the list that will impact other components because the offload action works with products with barcode formats. So I suggest that you please scan the trolley when *Finish* the Offload action same as the Loading process.

Answer: As long as the user is aware that there is a trolley which is expected back then that’s fine.

If there is a trolley then we can do the following:

* Offloading done
* Finish selected - when they do this, if trolley was loaded on this route in the morning then it doesn’t need to ask if trolley on route. It should just ask for the scan for trolley and if they advise not here then need this highlighting some way.
column464:
* *-Requirement Description:-* -The requirement is to add Asset (Trolley) Tracking via QR Code, Scanning, and Asset Lifecycle Tracking functionalities to the existing Fleet Assets page.-

*-Functional Requirements:-*

-Asset Entry and QR Code Generation:-

 

-·         When a new asset, such as a trolley, is added to the Fleet Assets table, a QR code should be generated and displayed in a new column labelled "QR Code."-

-·         For existing assets missing a QR code, users can manually generate one by selecting the asset and clicking the “Generate QR Code” button, similar to the existing Barcode generation functionality.-

-·         On clicking the barcode, provide the ability to view the barcode on a separate screen with options to print or download the file.-

 

-Tracking Asset Movement via QR Code and Scanning:-

 

-·         Each time an asset is moved, such as when it is loaded onto a vehicle for transport, its QR code must be scanned respective to the vehicle in the driver’s PDA app.-

-·         Upon scanning, the system will automatically update the “Current Location” and “Location Updated At” fields for the asset in the Fleet Assets table.-

 

-Asset Lifecycle Tracking and Updates:-

 

-As assets are scanned and moved, the system will log all interactions and automatically update their lifecycle status (total duration since the asset is added to the list). This data is displayed in the same Fleet Assets table under a new Lifecycle column-

 

*-Acceptance Criteria:-*

# -QR codes are generated automatically or manually for each asset in the Fleet Assets table.-

# -Asset movements are logged, and the location is updated upon scanning the QR code in driver’s PDA.-

# -Lifecycle status is calculated and updated automatically for each asset.-

 

-Updated the scanning on 18/10/2024 10:43AM-

+*-Scanning:-*+



* -Require this during outbound and inbound flow for loading/off loading.- 
* -When loading onto route - once load session is selected as complete, prompt to show to ask if trolley on this route, if yes then they will have to scan barcode of the trolley. If they select no then proceed to their next job.- 
* -When offloading, system to try and perceive this is as an product which is required to be scanned back in at point of offloaded so appears on offloading list as well.-





*-Benefits-*

# -Enhanced tracking of asset movements and lifecycle providing cost analysis-

# -Improved accuracy in logging asset status and usage.-

# -Improved accountability and operational efficiency-

# -Data accuracy and enhanced reporting-

*-Existing Barcodes:-* -we can leverage the existing- -barcodes associated with each asset (Trolley) in the following list exponentially reducing the developmental timeframe.- [https://toolbox.bjshomedelivery.com/toolbox-ng/dist/#/fleet/assets|https://toolbox.bjshomedelivery.com/toolbox-ng/dist/#/fleet/assets|smart-link]  



*-Suggestion to stakeholders (-*-kindly specifically suggest if you want to include this feature):-

*-Picture Capture During Scanning:-*

-·         After scanning an asset’s QR code, the system will prompt the user to capture a picture of the asset via their mobile device or tablet.-

-·         The image will be linked to the scan event and saved in the asset’s history, allowing users to review these images in the Asset Details section for audit or verification purposes.-

column517:
18/Oct/24 9:40 AM;712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33;Meeting key points:



* Asset tag - Get list of all assets (trolleys) Sarah Riaz will provide. Needs to be imported onto the system to be scannable through the networks.
* Barcodes would need to match to the asset. Assign barcodes to the asset. 
* Scan these at load is fine for us. 
* Return - Offload it and scan it into Speedy.
* Scanning - work in loading and offloading flows. Process change once the asset is loaded onto the vehicle, we need to expect it back off that vehicle at offload as an expected item such as products. Offload process to be same as the products one for offloading. 
* Sarah Riaz needs a view of those assets to monitor the history. Sarah Riaz has asked for this on asset management.  Time stamp and history. Day scanned out and day scanned in. *Toolbox dashboard > fleet assets.* 
* Sarah is happy with barcodes and doesn’t have to be QR codes. 



Exception:

* What if asset tag comes on and how do you determine which one it is? Might have to hand write onto the trolley as well. This is for Sarah Riaz. 
* Sarah Riaz to manage what is missing etc. 
* Warehouse scan it in and scan it out.
* This would go through outbound process. 



Check under location scan if we could just scan against the van. 

Loading function will it allow for the asset to be scanned even though not assigned for that route. 



Harry sangha to go look at the toolbox table they have.

Hope this covers what you need.

Thank you.

column223: 10/Oct/24 12:33 PM;712020:c23b50d9-23a0-4fd8-aeb9-a4ecb823d4ad;Requirement sign off- log new defect on toolbox fleet.docx;https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/59067
column464:
* *Requirement Description:* The requirement is to enhance the existing defect-logging feature within the system. When a user logs a new defect and selects "Tyre and Wheel" as the breakdown type, additional fields should be presented to capture specific tyre-related information, such as tyre position, fault reason, tyre tread depth (if worn), and tyre brand.

* *Functional Requirements:*

When the user selects *"Tyre and Wheels"* from the *Breakdown* drop-down, additional fields should be displayed to capture tyre-specific information. These fields will not appear for other defect types.

# *Tyre Position:* Drop-down menu

Allows the user to specify the tyre's location on the vehicle.

*Options:*

§  OSR (Off-Side Rear)

§  OSF (Off-Side Front)

§  NSR (Near-Side Rear)

§  NSF (Near-Side Front)

# *Add Fault Reasons:* Drop-down menu

Add these three specific reasons for tyre-related defects.

*Options:*

§  Bulge

§  Blowout

§  Worn

# *Tyre Tread Depth:* Free-text input (Numeric)

Allows users to record the remaining tread depth of the worn tyre (in millimetres).

*Condition:* This field will appear only if *"Worn"* is selected from the *Fault Reason* drop-down.

 

# *Tyre Brand:* Drop-down menu

A new field allows users to specify the brand of the tyre. This will help track brand-specific defect patterns.

*Options:*

§  Fortune

§  Hi-Fly

§  Greenmax

§  Autogreen

§  Bridgestone

*Acceptance Criteria:*

# Update the *Defect Logging Form* to include the new fields, which will dynamically appear based on the user’s selection of "Tyre and Wheel" as the Breakdown type.
# *The Tread Depth* field (if shown) should only accept numeric values (e.g., 0-99 mm).
# All drop-down menus should be required fields when the breakdown type is "Tyre and Wheels".
# Verify that the *Tread Depth* field appears and functions correctly when "Worn" is selected.

*Benefits*

* Cost tracking and savings
* Improved accountability and operational efficiency
* Data accuracy and enhanced reporting
* Supplier Optimization

 

----

Fields need to be added onto the Fleet > Log defect & Vehicle Defects.

Vehicle defects - when selecting tyres > Add additional drop down which only shows when selecting Tyres.

!WhatsApp Image 2024-10-24 at 13.15.20_c4da9878-20241028-075634.jpg|width=1280,height=478,alt="WhatsApp Image 2024-10-24 at 13.15.20_c4da9878-20241028-075634.jpg"!

PDA - log defect from the above page as well. 



Amardeep will amend these themselves once changes done.

*Subject:* Re: Toolbox changes

 

Good afternoon [@Amardeep Sandhu|mailto:amardeep.sandhu@bjshomedelivery.com],

Could you please provide a link to the dashboard fleet uses for Tyre reports.

[@Sarah Riaz|mailto:sarah.riaz@bjshomedelivery.com] could you clarify where exactly the new fields need to go onto besides logging new defect.

Does it need to show on the following toolbox pages as well:

* Vehicle Tyre Check - Do we need to reflect this on the driver check or are we only applying this to night team?
* Vehicle Defects report - If this is required on here then 3 additional fields will make this dash a lot more congested. Are there any suggestions from your side as to how you would want this presented? 

Thank you 

*Kind Regards,*

column1: count of orders
column35:
Hi,

I want to raise an issue which we are facing while debriefing the orders we are not able to check the exact count of orders done from our Id’s basically those orders which are debriefed FOC . The orders which are failed as per bjs Fault or for those orders where bjs has given foc services it doesn’t come in our total count. If we are debriefing the same order in different Portals likewise we are debriefing the order in twoman delivery and then debriefing in extra's portal it needs to be counted different order and should be calculated in total count.



thank you

column1: Pre-call notification tab or drop down for how many pre-calls are pending
column35:
Hello Jeevan,

As we use to have Task queue before to see how many pre-calls are pending, Now we only have pre-call notification icon to hover our mouse over it to see if pre-call has gone or now. And to do this for every single route would be difficult. If we can get a notification box or drop down box or pop up box on designer page or on review page that would be great. This feature would help us identify how many pre-call are pending on one click and if API is stuck/crashing we can update IT department to look into or Force pre-call again.

Regards 

Varun.





+*Current issue:*+

* Task queue has been removed from Options on Optimiser, gives overview of how much is pending. This has been removed as optimizer was slow and it helped with the speed. 



!image-20241018-113824.png|width=110,height=186,alt="image-20241018-113824.png"!

* Can only see which pre-calls gone through with the above icon.
* Can’t see why the pre call not gone through such as landline only or incorrect details etc. 

So under Toolbox called Multi Route Pre call - will send the remaining pre-calls which did not get sent. 



!image-20241018-114030.png|width=236,height=280,alt="image-20241018-114030.png"!

* Send pre calls based on depots. Once at home, they have to trigger multi route precall to be sure all sent. 
* Api failed to deliver is the biggest reason for the pre calls not sending the first time round. 
!image-20241018-114737.png|width=815,height=117,alt="image-20241018-114737.png"!
* At home - spending around half to 45 minutes or even an hour on this to make sure pre call is completed. Overtime for an individual. 

+*Current time for spending an precall:*+

* Wbury takes an hour or more. Other depots take 15 minute. If sending everything in 1 go then after half an hour still pre calls are sending. 



+*Requirement:*+

* 1 option to view all pre calls which have not gone through for whichever reason such as landline only etc. 

+*Benefits:*+

* Visibility of all orders which have received pre calls and which are pending so customer does not miss these comms which would lead to failed deliveries potentially. 
* Some Social Media complaints have come through to advise it’s slow and receiving 3 hour windows late and not receiving them. This would help reduce them. 
* Team efficiency and ensuring quality of service on behalf of BJS. 

 Who is asking for this?

Routing Team. 

When do they need this fix by?

By end of November or whenever IT can fit this in.

column510:
18/Oct/24 11:51 AM;712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33;Meeting with Amanjoot Khandola, Varun Sharma.

Manpreet K Gill and Amandeep Kaur

18/10/2024 

12:30PM.



+*Current issue:*+

* Task queue has been removed from Options on Optimiser, gives overview of how much is pending. This has been removed as optimizer was slow and it helped with the speed. 



!image-20241018-113824.png|width=110,height=186,alt="image-20241018-113824.png"!

* Can only see which pre-calls gone through with the above icon.
* Can’t see why the pre call not gone through such as landline only or incorrect details etc. 

So under Toolbox called Multi Route Pre call - will send the remaining pre-calls which did not get sent. 



!image-20241018-114030.png|width=236,height=280,alt="image-20241018-114030.png"!

* Send pre calls based on depots. Once at home, they have to trigger multi route precall to be sure all sent. 
* Api failed to deliver is the biggest reason for the pre calls not sending the first time round. 
!image-20241018-114737.png|width=815,height=117,alt="image-20241018-114737.png"!
* At home - spending around half to 45 minutes or even an hour on this to make sure pre call is completed. Overtime for an individual. 

+*Current time for spending an precall:*+

* Wbury takes an hour or more. Other depots take 15 minute. If sending everything in 1 go then after half an hour still pre calls are sending. 



+*Requirement:*+

* 1 option to view all pre calls which have not gone through for whichever reason such as landline only etc. 

+*Benefits:*+

* Visibility of all orders which have received pre calls and which are pending so customer does not miss these comms which would lead to failed deliveries potentially. 
* Some Social Media complaints have come through to advise it’s slow and receiving 3 hour windows late and not receiving them. This would help reduce them. 
* Team efficiency and ensuring quality of service on behalf of BJS. 

 Who is asking for this?

Routing Team. 

When do they need this fix by?

By end of November or whenever IT can fit this in.

column420:
*Filters:* 
1) Date Range 

2)Time Range

3)Depot

4)Staff: Two options: Warehouse and Driver. Default option will be Warehouse.

*Export Function:* This function will export the data in csv with information of Name of User, BJS ID, All the scanner actions with count, Depot, Team, Action, Last Location and Time.

*Information on Dashboard:* 

1)User name with BJS ID
2)Receive Count
3) Picking Count
4) Preload Count
5) Loading Count
6) Route
7) Depot
8) Team
9 )Last Location
10) Time


*Summary will remain the same as it is now.*

09/Oct/24 9:25 AM;712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33;*From:* Manpreet Gill <[manpreet.gill@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:manpreet.gill@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Sent:* Wednesday, October 9, 2024 10:23 AM
*To:* Harry Sangha <[harry.sangha@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:harry.sangha@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Subject:* BJS-34331 - Toolbox > Picking > Subcontractor - Action Date > transfer list showing transfers which don't have the same action date.

 

Good morning,

Our team have looked at the feasibility, advised this is not currently feasible due to the following points:

# The *DATE* field is regarding the date of sub-contractor transfer not regarding the order-action date.
# If we try to implement this changes forcefully, than what about the offshore orders which have sub-contracted transfer meta but those orders are not confirmed.

Therefore, we're not able to assist with this at this point in time.

We will mark it as parked to consider in the new DMS, when we look at the functionality for subcontractors etc. 

Thank you. 

*Kind Regards,*

 

|*Manpreet K Gill*
Operational BA

+44 7442 440 761|
Ext: 1078| |



    

     

BJS Distribution Storage and Couriers Limited

column1: G-SIT Issue - order being debrifed but not reflecting in invoicing pool
column35:
Hi,

We are Facing Issue regarding Debriefed orders; Orders are Being Debriefed but not reflecting in Invoicing Pool.



For Example: - Consignment Number: - B7222825-7303 is Debriefed but not Being Reflecting To Invoicing Pool.



Need to look into this issue as urgent. also, we need to figure out if there are more orders like this . 



@[sunil.singh@bjshaulage.com|mailto:sunil.singh@bjshaulage.com] For Visibility

column505:
04/Oct/24 10:20 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Vishal Rathore added:*
Hi [~accountid:62a71e93d0132d00687f47de] [~accountid:712020:686434c8-5766-4071-b00c-da0e96f295a9] [~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:756886b3-510e-4c9e-8982-ff99d730d45e]  ,


Team have checked example order : - Consignment Number: - B7222825-7303 is a transferred offshore order and observed user has cleared booking status before debriefing second time which shouldnt be done as GSIT wont accept it under invoicing and order wouldnt be shown in invoicing pool.

We should be checking with user here the reason to do so ? is that a normal process while debriefing or a special case ? 

To unblock please ask user to these perform these steps on extra portal

# delete charge logs 
!image-20241004-101933.png|width=1265,height=227,alt="image-20241004-101933.png"!
# clear booking status 
# confirm booking date
# debrief again (this time with delivery date)

User should be able to see the order in invoiving pool then
Please confirm when done 

FYV [Project Managers|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/1e1cc803-9b3d-46b2-9ff5-bb596c4affe7?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:712020:fef9c044-2a5c-44a4-a622-ca442785b4f1])

As for this ongoing issue, Our dev team checked for consignment no:- B7222825-7303 is a transferred offshore order and the observed team has cleared booking status before debriefing a second time which shouldn't be done as GSIT won't accept it under-invoicing and order wouldn't be shown in invoicing pool.

Could you please confirm whether this is a normal debriefing process or a special case?


For unblocking could you please perform these steps on the extra portal:

# delete charge logs
!image-20241004-101933.png|width=50%,alt="image-20241004-101933.png"!
# clear booking status
# confirm booking date
# debrief again (this time with the delivery date)

Kindly update us, so that we can check with the reporter.

FYI [~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:9a122dcf-c62c-43ad-b0ca-37977b19aa94] , [~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:756886b3-510e-4c9e-8982-ff99d730d45e]

column508:
07/Oct/24 10:15 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Ankita Chandel added:*
Hi ,

Yes, it is the normal process mainly while doing offshore orders and preroute orders as on offshore extra's orders we need to charge 44 in two man delivery and when we are charging it in extra's portal we need to clear booking status and the force debrief it unless we are not able to debrief these orders and same case with the preroute when date is already booked we need to clear the booking status then debrief as failed.



Thank you ,

Ankita

column1: Adding carrier change at point of import
column35:
all manifests are imported through GSIT 
are we able to add another function on the data import section where we are able to change the carrier for the entire manifest at point of upload?
column464:
User story:

I want to be able to select carrier, when importing an manifest. 

Current issue, pick and pack orders currently have to go into these and change the carrier one by one. 

Manual work required and takes time based on the volume of orders we have to change carrier for. 

Want to be able to select the carrier at point of import so don’t have to go into each order to change it.

Thank you

Good morning [~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:40b90e56-122b-4887-a295-cace2c7349f5] ,



Please could you confirm availability on Tuesday to discuss the following for this ticket:



* Current impact on business - included with cost and time spent.
* Requirements 
* Benefits - for operations.
* Timeline for when you require this done by.

Would Tuesday 22/10 13:00 work for you?

Thank you.
column511:
18/Oct/24 2:02 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Orders Department added:*
Hi  

  

Unfortunately my availability is very limited at this moment of time. Feel free to give me a call anytime to discuss and we can quickly go over  

On the other hand, please see below, and see if this is helpful:  

  

Current Impact on Business – Taking the orders team a lot of time to go into every single order to change the carrier, especially when there is a big file  

  

Requirements – To add a function on the data import page where it allows us to change the carrier at point of import for the entire manifest  

  

Benefits – it will save the orders team a lot of time, which can be used on other tasks  

  

Timeline – asap if possible 
|

column1: Updating the tracking ID
column35:
The delivery to this postcode got late due to damage to the headboard due to which this customer opened a claim on Amazon.

This claim is in review now.

The tracking ID on the delivery note is of the replacement part only but the tracking IDD uploaded on Amazon is of the order that failed.

Is it possible to update the tracking ID on the BJS portal so that the old tracking ID shows that the order is delivered instead of the new tracking?

 

Attachments:

column523:
15/Oct/24 8:48 AM;63b5397e48b367d78a17e89d;[~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:0692c329-6b4b-4e60-b266-a9a23440f38d] Here, As client is adding tracking Id’s in Amazon, As per checking that client is passing Consignment as Tracking ID to Amazon, which can possible be reason that Amazon haven’t taken the events for split Order as it has different Consignment.
If client share Order Number as Tracking Id then Amazon is able to send the events for both orders.


[BA Team|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/82f7f91b-6125-47ae-9f99-2f58f77c0c58?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7] [~accountid:712020:c23b50d9-23a0-4fd8-aeb9-a4ecb823d4ad] [~accountid:712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33]) want to ask, when we create order we are sending the labels but are we sending labels when we split the orders.



[~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:62beceeff53d91673869f19a] FYI
column524:
16/Oct/24 8:45 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Manpreet K Gill added:*
[~accountid:63b5397e48b367d78a17e89d]  i believe we discussed this yesterday but will mention it in points below:

* Splitting orders - labels do get sent to the customer or even warehouse to attach.
* If splitting an order which customer provides their own barcodes for - then we just split and the client can send with their own label.
* Most cases, when we split order it’s because we’ve partially delivered items to the customer and client is ready to send the remaining missing stock so we split the order based on lines not received on. Then send labels for the clients.

In all possible scenarios, the order number stays the same but consignment number is unique per split as treated as new order.

Hope this helps 

fyi [BA Team|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/82f7f91b-6125-47ae-9f99-2f58f77c0c58?ref=jira$&src=issue] ( [~accountid:712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7] [~accountid:712020:c23b50d9-23a0-4fd8-aeb9-a4ecb823d4ad])

[~accountid:62beceeff53d91673869f19a] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]
column525:
16/Oct/24 9:53 AM;63b5397e48b367d78a17e89d;[~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:0692c329-6b4b-4e60-b266-a9a23440f38d]  Here, As client is adding tracking Id’s in Amazon, As per checking that client is passing Consignment as Tracking ID to Amazon, which can possible be reason that Amazon haven’t taken the events for split Order as it has different Consignment.

As mentioned by [~accountid:712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33]  the order number stays the same but consignment number is unique per split as treated as new order.


If client share Order Number as Tracking Id then Amazon is able to get events for both orders as liked by Order Number.

[~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:62beceeff53d91673869f19a][~accountid:712020:c23b50d9-23a0-4fd8-aeb9-a4ecb823d4ad]  FYI
column527:
17/Oct/24 7:55 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Angad Agustya Vaid added:*
Hi [~accountid:qm:d8ea2a9b-55ad-4515-8ac6-615ee94f46cc:0692c329-6b4b-4e60-b266-a9a23440f38d] 

Our recommendation is to utilise the original order number as the tracking ID instead of the consignment number, as this approach ensures that Amazon can recognise events for both the original and split orders.

Amazon retrieves delivery details from our system via API by themselves based on the order information provided by our client. Therefore, we are unable to update the status of the mentioned delivery from our end.

[~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33] [~accountid:63b5397e48b367d78a17e89d] [~accountid:712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7]
column529:
17/Oct/24 11:16 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Angad Agustya Vaid added:*
Sure, keep us posted. Thanks 
[~accountid:63b5397e48b367d78a17e89d] [~accountid:712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33]

column1: Email Notifications - Query
column35:
Dusk Request, 



Hi , 

I have received the below request from DUSK 

_Please can you confirm that if we turn off transactional tracking email from yourself, you will not still contact the customer to arrange delivery, re confirm delivery and for any communication on the day of delivery?_

Could you please confirm if this is possible and if there’s any impact to us doing this? 

 

Attachments:
column464:
Requirement:

* Dusk want to be able to select which comms can go out to their customers. 
* For example, on the day of delivery they want to be able to select comms for confirmation for delivery today but not send comms confirming the 3 hour window to the customer. 

Who’s asked for this?

* Dusk has requested this. 

Benefit:

* Client will be able to decide what comms go out to their customers.

Note:

Once I have gotten the estimated cost for doing this change, stakeholder will confirm with client if they are able to accept the charges. Will check feasibility of this first and then confirm.
column502:

Thank you.
column503:
19/Sep/24 10:14 AM;712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33;*From:* Manpreet Gill <[manpreet.gill@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:manpreet.gill@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Sent:* Thursday, September 19, 2024 11:13 AM
*To:* Jade Lang <[Jade.Lang@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:Jade.Lang@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Subject:* Re: COTS Doorstep discount

 

Hi Jade,

That's brilliant, I'll schedule 3 meetings.

Each consisting of 15 minutes max.

Need to see accurate stock level for available and allocated and also visibility of historical orders stock has been allocated/fulfilled.

column464:
!image-20240910-155904.png|width=1568,height=526,alt="image-20240910-155904.png"!

*Issue 1:*

* Location’s aren’t the only one’s showing. It seems to show order scans for that stock such as w-bury 07, delivered etc. This means the system seems to be taking in the scans from 2 man and showing them as location on this dashboard which is incorrect. Once delivered, it should marked as fulfilled but as per the screenshot nothing in fulfilled. You can only see it in the reserved which is incorrect. 
* Reserved orders showing nothing - not sure if this is due to the above issue. 

*Issue 2:*

* When adjusting stock - we have to select an reason for the adjustment. This is currently not reflecting on the activity of the product. Only shows stock unreceived but not gives reason but you can see these on the toolbox > stock > stock adjustment logs. This causes issues for investigation purposes.

Example:

Code: TPCE017124 

Client BELVEO DIRECT

Stock adjusted on Sept 3 = unreceipted it but no reason showing on the activity. 



!image-20240910-160539.png|width=981,height=257,alt="image-20240910-160539.png"!

On the adjustment logs you can see the reasons:



!image-20240910-160623.png|width=1774,height=43,alt="image-20240910-160623.png"!

This needs to be showing in the activity as well.

*Issue 3:*



!image-20240911-091154.png|width=1501,height=58,alt="image-20240911-091154.png"!

* When  this scan for transferred to dd happens for offshore stock. Mark as fulfilled 

*Issue 4*: 1 product with multiple parts showing different information under allocated.

1679167.33 - Show’s orders allocated. Most of these have already been delivered, Only 1 which should be showing as not delivered and this only has this sku. 

1679167.23 - Shows no orders in the allocated. This is correct information. 



!image-20240912-104155.png|width=843,height=946,alt="image-20240912-104155.png"!

As discussed, after meeting the criteria’s after which the count should show under Fulfilled, the count is still being displayed under Reserved. 
Also have found few more things which should be fixed, 

So regarding the point that the scans are being transferred to another location, such as Delivered or any Depot. 
Is because, when we scan the Product via scanning or PDA, then the Scanned Location also gets updated under Stock Product table, This should not happen, by which it will then display the correct count, that how many products were receipted on a location, and then how many of them were reserved from a particular location, and how many got fulfilled. This will also cover point 3 mentioned on the ticket. 

Also when the Stock Adjust API is getting hit, then under the Stock Products log API, we need to create a record under Activity log for the same product too about same. 
So assigning this back to you.

column514:
01/Oct/24 1:59 PM;6149eb1ecee20b0069d55f64;[~accountid:712020:1660b04f-bb59-47f7-b2c1-abbf776455d9] I have tested the fixes and now when Adjusting the stock using scanner, then also the Selected reason is being displayed under Audit logs. As well as when we adjust the stock using Toolbox. 

!image-20241001-134829.png|width=394,height=102,alt="image-20241001-134829.png"!

Also now when the item gets scanned anywhere after being marked as Picked, for eg, under preload, loading, on-route etc. Then the scanned location is now not being updated on toolbox dashboard. 

Done the regression round on this and points 1 to point 3 are covered, the issues are resolved. 

*But while testing, i have found a issue under Stock Adjust Logic, (i.e When adjusting Stock product, the system is also considering the Products which have been marked as Fulfilled, for eg: If there is Product on Location 1, with Stock Quantity as 5, and Reserved qty as 3 and Fulfilled qty as 10,* 
Then when we are trying to adjust the Stock, for say to 18, then it will not do any adjustment, as the system will also count the 10 stock from Fulfilled. 

So the adjustment should only consider the Stocks which are either Reserved, or not allocated yet. *Do not consider the Stock which have been marked as Fulfilled.* 
Assigning this ticket back. 

FYV [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328]

column420:
*Current Issue* 

* Advance search on Toolbox to be amended so when we export the file - should show all items in an order on separate lines. Currently export is client order basis. For example, if we export an order with 5 items. Currently export shows the order on 1 line. We need to see 5 lines for each part of the order weight, code, description, weight, cbm and location.
* Currently 1 staff member at night has to do it. 1 staff member spends all shift exporting, staff member is at standard pay rate



+*Requirement*+ 



On Toolbox > Orders > Order Search > Advanced > *Manifest Export > Add another Option called Export Manifest. Rename the current option to Export CSV.* 

!image-20240906-140610.png|width=2476,height=237,alt="image-20240906-140610.png"!

Export file to have the following changes made:

* Route 
* File to show based on item’s and not orders. So an line for each item on an order. So they can see location of each item as well. 



Benefits:

* Any items which have not been picked, we find this out using this advanced search and it’s safety check.
* All picking completed this way.
* Customer satisfaction

 

Cons:

* Incorrect information on Toolbox so currently having to use GSIT

Example of what’s currently showing on toolbox.

 

[^Order_Manifest_1725631670.xlsx]



Example of how it should be showing: This example is missing the Route Number column which is required. 

[^Order_Manifest_06092024151044.csv]

column1: toolbox - ASSETS- FLEET PARTS
column35:
On the following URL: [https://toolbox.bjshomedelivery.com/fleet/van_parts_stock_report,|https://toolbox.bjshomedelivery.com/fleet/van_parts_stock_report,] need to add a button that would allow the deletion of parts that are no longer required.  

Each year the van models change which results in parts that are no longer needed polluting the UI. A delete button would allow the fleet team to perform the cleanup and remove unnecessary parts.

----

*From:* Manpreet Gill <[manpreet.gill@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:manpreet.gill@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Sent:* Tuesday, October 22, 2024 2:14 PM
*To:* Sarah Riaz <[sarah.riaz@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:sarah.riaz@bjshomedelivery.com]>; Angad Agustya Vaid <[angad.vaid@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:angad.vaid@bjshomedelivery.com]>; Prabveer Singh <[prabveer@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:prabveer@bjshomedelivery.com]>; Amardeep Sandhu <[amardeep.sandhu@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:amardeep.sandhu@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Cc:* Daniel Zentani <[daniel.zentani@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:daniel.zentani@bjshomedelivery.com]>; Amandeep Kaur <[amandeep.kaur@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:amandeep.kaur@bjshomedelivery.com]>; Vishal Rathore <[vishal.rathore@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:vishal.rathore@bjshomedelivery.com]>; Amarjit Singh <[amarjit@bjshomedelivery.com|mailto:amarjit@bjshomedelivery.com]>
*Subject:* Re: Toolbox changes

 

Good afternoon [@Amardeep Sandhu|mailto:amardeep.sandhu@bjshomedelivery.com],

Could you please provide a link to the dashboard fleet uses for Tyre reports.

[@Sarah Riaz|mailto:sarah.riaz@bjshomedelivery.com] could you clarify where exactly the new fields need to go onto besides logging new defect.

Does it need to show on the following toolbox pages as well:

* Vehicle Tyre Check - Do we need to reflect this on the driver check or are we only applying this to night team?
* Vehicle Defects report - If this is required on here then 3 additional fields will make this dash a lot more congested. Are there any suggestions from your side as to how you would want this presented? 

Thank you 

*Kind Regards,*

 

|*Manpreet K Gill*
Operational BA|

column1: Toolbox - Route Slider picking up last value, instead of current value.

Its picking up the last set value, instead of the value which is set currently. 
So for eg, if i am selecting 20 routes using Route slider, nothing will happen at first, But when if i move the Slider to select 10 routes or 30, then under the Routes field, its selecting 20 routes, instead of 10 or 30.

[~accountid:5fb985bbdd0c590075cc2912] We have implemented the changes, and the task is now in the testing phase.
Our testing team has identified an issue on Toolbox while creating Picking jobs for Standard and Sub-Contractor, the Route Slider option is not working properly. 

Its picking up the last set value, instead of the value which is set currently. 
So for example, if i am selecting 20 routes using Route slider, nothing will happen at first, But when if i move the Slider to select 10 routes or 30, then under the Routes field, its selecting 20 routes, instead of 10 or 30.
We believe the functionality should work with the current selection. We would appreciate your confirmation on this matter to ensure we are aligned and that no aspect of the functionality is overlooked.

We apologies for the need to seek your confirmation again and thank you for your continued support.
Thankyou

column517:
22/Aug/24 3:24 PM;6149eb1ecee20b0069d55f64;[~accountid:6188eabb137a51006a374287] I was running few more cases on this, and found out that the Route filter is causing some issues when creating Sub-Contractor jobs. 

# For orders which are Sub-Contracted to 3rd Party, (like Panthers, Direct Deliveries NI etc.), these orders do not have any action date from our end as it gets delivered by the contractors. 
*Now for eg, If i create a transfer for Direct Deliveries, and then try to Create Sub-Contractor pick job, then the Route Filter is compulsory now to create job, and if i Pass unrouted, then no jobs are getting created, as the Unrouted Filter seems to be searching for the Orders which are confirmed for the Passed date, but not routed.*
# In case of Extra Orders which gets subcontracted to 2 man, its also hampering the pick jobs for those orders too, 
*For eg:  If we create a Transfer for orders on Extra portal to 2Man, which were confirmed for say 27/08/2024, but while creating transfer if i set the Transfer date to any other date, like 24/08/2024. Then also its not creating the picks for those orders, as the system is trying to find the orders which are confirmed for 24/08/2024.* 
This also is blocking the users to create the jobs for unconfirmed orders. 

Please look into this. 

FYV [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728]

The scope of this ticket is to create picking for extra transferred order wrt routes, for the same Harry requested the route changes under the Sub-Contractor because there is no way to cover this case under Standard one.

*What we can do for this,* We will allow users to create picking for “extra” transfers under Standard, which is the solution for this task.

We recommend not handling this under the Sub-Contractor module because the date-picker is meant for the transfer list, not routes. Making changes here would risk breaking the existing functionality of the Sub-Contractor module.

Thank you

column1: Putaway Function on scanners
column35: to be able to have a function on scanners to put away stock, this will allow to log in the database the quantity of orders/parts an individual user has scanned. to be able to see the utilisation of resource.
column55:
Understand the task
checked the current functionality 
updated the requirements
Mentioned the exceptions
Created the flow
discussed with manpreet;16/Aug/24 3:46 PM;712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7;13500
column420:
*As a* Warehouse Manager,
*I need* a Putaway function on Scanner for 2-Man Warehouses,
*So that* I can understand how much stock the team is put away for each client.

*Acceptance criteria:*

* We have a put away function for the Direct warehouse. We need an icon for “Putaway” on scanner’s  home screen for 2-Man.
* When the user clicks on put away, the functionality should be  similar to the Receive function of the scanner.
* When user clicks on Putaway, it should open up with location at the top, allowing the user to scan the location. 
* After scanning the location, the user can scan the stock/products. There are no restrictions here; they can scan any product for any client.
* The system should allow scanning to multiple locations and log where each order has been placed.
* The job will remain open until the user closes it, allowing them to put away everything needed before closing it.
*Toolbox Dashboard:*
* Data of how much stock a user has put away for each client, including how many parts were put away during a particular session. Ability to filter by client to see stock levels and Putaway history.
* Each Putaway session should be logged with details like start time, end time, products scanned, and locations used.
* Similar to picking dashboard, this will needed for each warehouse for racking locations.
* The dashboard should update in real-time, reflecting all Putaway actions as they happen


Exceptions:

* The user scans a location different from the assigned one.
Solution: Alert the user with an option to confirm the change or re-scan the correct location.
* The scanned product isn't recognized by the system or isn’t assigned to any client.
Solution: Prompt the user to verify the product and allow for manual input or allocation.
* The user doesn’t complete putting away all stock but needs to pause and resume later.
Solution: Allow the session to be saved and resumed without losing any logged data.
* Certain products may have special handling requirements or restrictions (e.g., hazardous materials).
Solution: Restrict these products from being placed in unsuitable locations, prompting the user with approved alternatives..
* The scanner session may time out or disconnect before completion.
Solution: Implement auto-save features and reconnect options to prevent data loss.
* Stock is placed in the wrong location by mistake.
Solution: Implement a verification step or a review process to confirm the location before finalizing the Putaway.

1) Source location will be checked by receiving activity.
2) There will be no linking with any other sessions of other modules.
3) There will no operational work required on toolbox dashboard.
4) The user will select the location and scan the products. This activity can be repeated any number of times within one session. This will work according to users' sessions.
5) This will work for only Harry's warehouse.
6) Dashboard on toolbox to show all the data.
7) One point I missed here, we need to show the orders info as well on toolbox dashboard.
7) According to Akhil there will be 2 weeks of development time on toolbox and scanning side. [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] pls confirm from testing and API side as well.

column517:
27/Sep/24 12:17 PM;62beceeff53d91673869f19a;[~accountid:712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7]  I have gone through the tech review and the description above. 
I have few doubts and listing it down. Kindly answer the queries for clarification and afterwards I will let you know the time estimation.

* As [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328]  mentioned, there is a put away functionality working. What does that do, I am still not clear about that?
* [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328]  How the location is scanned on scanner, could you give me a brief insight on this please?
* As [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328]  asked, I have same question. What will be the average quantity of products to be moved in 1 go?
* Should the user be able to scan products for 1 client at a time or for any client at any time ?
* As you mentioned that job should remain open for that particular user and will be closed once done. Should there be a time limit for the same or the job could remain open for years to come if not closed manually in any exceptional case?
* You mentioned in the tech review, location will be scanned for the destination location only, so what is the meaning of → *The user scans a location different from the assigned one. →* Does this mean to validate if the location is same as the previous one?
* How we will know a certain location is not a suitable one to store hazardous items?
* *Stock is placed in the wrong location by mistake →* This statement is ambiguous. Firstly we are saying, save items on the go. Then we are saying session should be saved and not be destroyed. Lastly we say It could be continued. This means either we give an option on each scan to verify if its the right location (not user friendly approach) else we need to scan multiple items in a row and then add a button *To Be Continued* which would save the session as well as the data and verify check on exiting. Is this correct or you have something else in mind?



I need to know the plan from [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328] , how you are planning to develop this up. What is needed from my end? Currently the sessions, scans and locations are managed by Toolbox and the final location is saved in Gsit DB only through API.



FYI [Project Managers|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/1e1cc803-9b3d-46b2-9ff5-bb596c4affe7?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:712020:fef9c044-2a5c-44a4-a622-ca442785b4f1] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]) [~accountid:712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33]
column518:
30/Sep/24 10:01 PM;712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7;# There is a put away functionality working. What does that do, I am still not clear about that? *Current Putaway: This applies to Direct, where we already have stock available before the order is placed in the system. In this process, we will receive products that are linked to specific orders and then proceed with putaway.*
# Should the user be able to scan products for 1 client at a time or for any client at any time ?-- *Multiple client in same session.*
# As you mentioned that job should remain open for that particular user and will be closed once done. Should there be a time limit for the same or the job could remain open for years to come if not closed manually in any exceptional case?--- *We haven't addressed this exception yet, as we were focusing on the general flow. But we can implement a time limit, for example, 1 or 2 days, once we have confirmation from the stakeholders*
# You mentioned in the tech review, location will be scanned for the destination location only, so what is the meaning of → The user scans a location different from the assigned one. *→* Does this mean to validate if the location is same as the previous one?--- *Yes there will be an validation and selection .*
# How we will know a certain location is not a suitable one to store hazardous items? *With the product information, we can determine whether it needs to be placed in a safe or secure location. For now, we can alert the user to place it in a verified location with care. However, we won’t focus too much on this at the moment. We'll review it with the stakeholders and add it if necessary.*
# *Stock is placed in the wrong location by mistake →* This statement is ambiguous. Firstly we are saying, save items on the go. Then we are saying session should be saved and not be destroyed. Lastly we say It could be continued. This means either we give an option on each scan to verify if its the right location (not user friendly approach) else we need to scan multiple items in a row and then add a button *To Be Continued* which would save the session as well as the data and verify check on exiting. Is this correct or you have something else in mind?-- Perfect

[~accountid:62beceeff53d91673869f19a] Our aim is to give the stakeholders a rough idea of the amount of work required for this. We will cover all the details once we receive confirmation from them. At that point, Akhil will be able to provide a detailed process flow as well.

Thankyou

column526:
23/Oct/24 11:12 AM;712020:f57f118c-1548-4679-a91b-e0f1f6725fbc;[~accountid:712020:40fd1585-f7c4-4ca9-8e53-63c2830ba4a6] *FYI, this is not a server issue.*

Your local machine operates as a client, and there are no root security or access restrictions, allowing you to upload files easily. However, on the server side, which operates as a network machine, there are security limitations for the root user.

The main issue we are encountering is related to file uploads. We currently have three pods, and when a file is uploaded successfully, it is stored only on one pod. This is happening because this deployment has no persistent volume (PV) or EFS/S3 storage integration.

Could you please use any available staging test bucket for file upload testing? By using this approach, your files will be stored in a centralized location, resolving the current issue.

column1: Be able to retain batch, sku, expiry information on a dashboard. Create picking via toolbox without the home delivery order
column329: PAUL WILSON TICKETS FOR RETAIN SKU BATCH INFORMATION & ABILITY TO GENERATE PICKS IN TOOLBOX

column1: Optimizer sending pre-call API crashing
column35:
Whenever we are sending Pre-call text and email to the customer, First Sending time slot process is slow, It is taking approx. 3-4 seconds to send one order text and email, calculating that with 3200+ order it is taking 2.5 hours. Second, API is crashing in between sending the time slot, Say if one route is having 23-28 orders, 10-12 orders text/email is a success but then API crashing and Router jumps on to next route and So on, because of which we have to trigger multi-route pre-call option 2-3 time. It has start happen from 01/07/2024 onwards, Though send process was still slow from last few months. As we do not have proper tool to measure how many order have got there time slot and how many are left this process is consuming time as we have to go through every single route one by one. Earlier it was 2 click process which usually takes 30-45 mins time period. 

Attachments: 
  

  [ image-20240706-091842.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/53739  ] - 170349 Bytes - Routing - 2024-07-06 
  [ image-20240706-091930.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/53740  ] - 174900 Bytes - Routing - 2024-07-06

column464:
* *Current Process:* 

When the team completes an order by selecting "Customer Not at Home" and then chooses to continue the order without contacting the office, customer, or client, the PDA currently skips the item scanning process and proceeds directly to the Property Walkthrough.

*Required Modifications:* 
We need to adjust the PDA workflow so that when "Continue Order" is selected, the team is first presented with the item scanning page. Only after completing the scanning process should they proceed with the delivery.

*Revised Steps:* 
* Complete the Pre-call process and proceed to the "Arrival Vehicle Photos" stage.
* Take the required vehicle photos
* Select "Vehicle Locked/Secured: Yes.
* Select "Customer at Home: No."
* Select "Someone will sign for order: No."

*Call Log Process*
* Who did you call? Select "Office."
* Office Status: Select "Not Answered."
* Order Action: Continue Order ( No Action will be taken)
* Input the time and submit.

!image-20240821-112523.png|width=388,height=512,alt="image-20240821-112523.png"!



!image-20240821-112600.png|width=376,height=493,alt="image-20240821-112600.png"!

*New Requirement: Product Scanning*

* Instead of proceeding directly to the Property Walkthrough, the PDA must now display the Product Scanning page if the order is being continued. The team must complete the scanning process before moving on to the delivery.

*Special Condition:*
If the order fails (e.g., the customer is not available and the order cannot be delivered), the Product Scanning step should be skipped, and the workflow should proceed directly to order failure handling.

*2nd requirement:* 
* Hide the barcode from the item description section to prevent the team from adding the barcode manually.

 

!image-20240821-113231.png|width=377,height=503,alt="image-20240821-113231.png"!



h3. *Benefits:* 

* Operational Efficiency: The revised workflow ensures that important steps like scanning are not skipped, leading to a more reliable process overall.
* Ensures Proper Scanning: Scanning items before delivery reduces the chance of missing or incorrectly recording items.
*  Reduces Errors: By removing the option to manually enter barcodes, the likelihood of human error in entering incorrect or duplicate barcodes is reduced.
* Enhances Traceability: The required scanning creates a clear record of what was actually scanned and delivered, making it easier to track items.
* Better Customer Experience : Customers receive the correct items, which reduces complaints and returns.
* Data Integrity: The process ensures that the information recorded is accurate and reliable.

* When the team fails the order by selecting a customer not at home and then selecting continue the order, the PDA will skip the item scanning process and go straight to delivery. Here we need to change the PDA flow so that when it’s selected to continue the order the team must see the scanning page first and only after doing the scanning can they go ahead with the delivery.
* Hide the Barcode from from the item description section, so that the team cannot add the barcode manually.

Let me know if to proceed ahead with these changes we need approval.

column1: 6- Integrate 3rd Party Carrier Labels into Picking to avoid secondary labelling requirement
column35:
For DHL, Panther, Wayfair etc we’re currently picking using standard BJS labels then having to apply 3rd Party shipping labels post-pick.

For small qty picks this isn’t an issue but for the large qty DHL picks we’re now having with LJ this is requiring up to 6 hours of additional labour just to relabel.

If we can integrate the actual 3rd party labels into the pick process this would be eradicated.

Sample of DHL label file attached.

column1: Require access to Google Tag Manager account
column35:
Access to Google Tag Manager account (created by Matt Walker way back). 

Attachments: 
  

  [ Screenshot 2024-06-05 at 09.46.46.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/52112  ] - 52572 Bytes - Joe Apperley - 2024-06-05
column224: 17/Oct/24 10:11 AM;712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7;Require access to Google Tag Manager account_signoff .docx;https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/59397
column464:
*Description:* Sites bjsfamily.com and bjshomedelivery.com currently use only analytics tag: G- F119RT40QW that is fine for the Google Analytics and required no alteration. * Step 1 - Someone creates a Google Tag Manager container. * Step 2 - The two snippets of ready-prepared code from GTM to be copied and pasted into the and of the website. * Step 3 - Set access permissions. * Step 4 - Done. We already have a Google Analytics tag as analytics are working, we don’t have the Google Tag Manager tag, which is above. We’ve managed to create and set up both Analytics and Tag Manager accounts, and deploy the code, for bjs-beyond and bjs-us. Full instructions on installing the container here: # Install a web container - Tag Manager Help Our container ID we have created is GTM-NBV8P5SZ The Container is created within the Google Tag Manager: Google Tag Manager Essentially this is required change: # Copy the first block of code and paste it as high in the tag as possible. Example In the following sample HTML code, you would paste your first Google Tag Manager code snippet after the opening HTML tag. Note that the following example uses 'GTM- ABCDEFGH,' but you must replace the ID with your container ID. Example Webpage

Welcome to My Website

This is a sample paragraph on my webpage.

# Copy the second block of code and paste it immediately after the opening tag. Example In the following sample HTML code, you would paste your second Google Tag Manager code snippet immediately after the opening HTML tag. Note that the following example uses 'GTM-ABCDEFGH,' but you must replace the ID with your container ID. Example Webpage

Welcome to My Website

This is a sample paragraph on my webpage.

Benefits: * Allows us to set up and manage tags on your site without changing your website's code.

column524:
22/Aug/24 1:29 PM;712020:5ff390be-b9a6-402e-81fa-7bfe8e10c9cb;How to add already created google tags to a google account and grant permissions for users to access them: 

!GoogleTagManager.mp4|width=1920,height=992,alt="GoogleTagManager.mp4"!

So navigate to [https://tagmanager.google.com/#/home|https://tagmanager.google.com/#/home] and then click on the ‘Google Tags’ menu option. You should see all the current google tags we have associated with our applications. From now on, we will create a new container for each application so we can keep a track of all the tags belonging to a particular application. To do this, under the ‘Accounts’ section, we can click create new account and then create the account for that application. After the account has been created, we can add any existing and new tags to that account. We can then give other users permission to create/modify/delete these tags. 



Next course of action: [~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] , we need to add the google analytics tags for each application on to this platform. On google tag manager, we would need to create a container for each application (on [devteam@bjsdistribution.com|mailto:devteam@bjsdistribution.com]), and then give the developers permissions to add tags to that container.  Let me know if you need more details or how you want to proceed.

column531:
24/Sep/24 12:27 PM;712020:360d1ff6-4534-4471-9619-16e136e0b7d4;Hello [~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] Sites [bjsfamily.com|http://bjsfamily.com] and [bjshomedelivery.com|http://bjshomedelivery.com] currently use only analytics tag: *G-F119RT40QW* that is fine for the Google Analytics and required no alteration 👍 !image-20240924-121157.png|width=1829,height=869,alt="image-20240924-121157.png"! h2. Required change The requirement is to add the Google Tag Manager to allow a Google tag container to be managed from here without need to add more code Google tag manager: *full instructions on installing the container here:* [https://support.google.com/tagmanager/answer/14847097?hl=en#:~:text=Add%20the%20Google%20tag%20in%20Google%20Tag%20Manager.%20Follow%20these|https://support.google.com/tagmanager/answer/14847097?hl=en#:~:text=Add%20the%20Google%20tag%20in%20Google%20Tag%20Manager.%20Follow%20these|smart-link] Our container ID we have created is *GTM-NBV8P5SZ* The Container is created within the Google Tag Manager: [Google Tag Manager|https://tagmanager.google.com/?authuser=1#/container/accounts/6246528801/containers/193669848/workspaces/2] *Essentially this is required change:* # Copy the first block of code and paste it as high in the {{}} tag as possible. *Example* In the following sample HTML code, you would paste your first Google Tag Manager code snippet after the opening ** HTML tag. Note that the following example uses '_GTM-ABCDEFGH_,' but you must replace the ID with your container ID.               **                                 Example Webpage     **                    

Welcome to My Website

       

This is a sample paragraph on my webpage.

        # Copy the second block of code and paste it immediately after the opening {{}} tag. *Example* In the following sample HTML code, you would paste your second Google Tag Manager code snippet immediately after the opening ** HTML tag. Note that the following example uses '_GTM-ABCDEFGH_,' but you must replace the ID with your container ID.                                               Example Webpage         **                                        

Welcome to My Website

       

This is a sample paragraph on my webpage.

    **     Please apply this simple change when you have availability for a deployment, If you do require any further information please let me know, thank you

column1: 5- QC - at receipt for Direct Stock
column35:
Toolbox - Generate labels with unique barcodes. 

Stick QC label on the item at point of receipt and then log QC. 

Picking - Assign order label, scan the label and then scan QC.
column328: Manav's Priority List 1
column464:
* -Toolbox - Generate labels with unique barcodes.- 
* -Stick QC label on the item at point of receipt and then log QC.- 
* -Picking - Assign order label, scan the label and then scan QC.-

!0_0_a=128881&x=-24129&y=-26072&w=1917&h=1589&store=1&accept=image%2F_&auth=LCA%2099d0945faaae708c2813fee46dccb529c49e450bec0a119007696a6ec829da2c-ts%3D1721120031|width=1917,height=1589!

+*Updated: 13/08/2024 12:34*+

h1. Dashboards required

*QC DASHBOARD FOR DIRECT STOCK*

# Qc – showing all product codes which will require QC. Be able to add and delete products on this. Scanning – when someone receives a product which is in this qc then scanning advises to do QC before proceeding to next step. Note, if they want to do QC for a product which is not on the list then this should also be possible.

# How to determine good or bad stock? QC Form to have an additional option – *Deliverable Product. Yes – Good Stock. No – Bad Stock. Require good stock and bad stock fields in the stock count of the product as well. Only allocate good stock to be allocated to orders and do not allow allocation of bad stock.*

# Good– Good stock is just images/details of receipt/product code etc.

# Bad Stock – Show product code, time of receipt, images etc. Be able to filter according to client and download mass report to send images in bulk of bad stock etc. *Option to mark as reported to client once sent images to client. Once marked as reported to client. Move to Pending – Bad stock bucket. Give option for disposal – when we click on disposal it will give input text box with reason. Once stock disposed of, need stock count to be changed accordingly and audit of all disposed stock. Audit log of all disposed bad stock required.*
# Pending qc - Be able to mark product as pending QC. When this happens, stock cannot be allocated once moved to good stock. +*Updated requirements on 10/09/2024 13:40*+

*How to log qc on direct order?*

# Toolbox > Input box for numbers only > generate labels which will have unique barcodes.

# Print labels.

# Scanning – Stock receipt – receive the stock and then stick qc label on then scan barcode to begin the QC. (If this specific product code is in the list of QC’s then do not let the individual proceed without QC).

# Additional Mandatory option in QC form – Deliverable product?

# Yes – proceed with the usual steps after receipt such as putaway.

# No – will be put into a location which Paul Wilson will decide for bad stock.

Barcode of the qc label will hold the details of the qc with images until product is assigned to an order.

*Picking:*

# Will allocate the picking label onto the product and scan.

# Then scan the QC label.

Which will link the qc to the order/barcode label scanned.

This will then reflect on gsit/toolbox against the order from then on.

*Note:* Bad stock – should not be allocated to any order. It is stock which is not available for allocation so only good stock should be allocated to any orders coming through home delivery gsit portal.

 *Future requirements WMS:* 

* Be able to create load job for disposals.
