# That’s correct, this has already been agreed with Paul Wilson. Please note, 2 types of scenario. If product is recorded on dash requiring QC when it comes in then it will be required any time receipting that product. The rest is optional. 
# Is QC in the current flow we have for 2 man? If so, then yes cover all QC options there. 

fyi [~accountid:712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7]
column547:
24/Oct/24 4:11 PM;62beceeff53d91673869f19a;[~accountid:712020:d692d74d-7eb4-44c0-97b3-456b2929de33] [~accountid:712020:07b60cb5-af46-4ff4-b9ca-5dbb56c0f1a7] 
{color:#ff5630}Is QC in the current flow we have for 2 man? If so, then yes cover all QC options there. {color}
-> Please think this through. When repacking, we have a option to split the products or consolidate it. If we talk about consolidate then we currently do order consolidation and not product consolidation. Product consolidation does not make sense technically at this point. This would be a new scenario and needs to be handled separately and this also means that we can’t use the current QC flow and need to increase the estimate development time. Please reconsider this and let us know how to proceed.



Another important point to note → If we are receipting stock for the first time and we don’t have that product code in our system in that case we are disabling QC check as we can’t generate unique labels due to missing product in the system. As already mentioned before in the tech review. For all the 1st time receipted products and those ones which are already there in the warehouse, how are we gonna do the QC check for them?

(SUGGESTION) Potentially what we can do → We can give another action in scanner to do QC for receipted products and we can do that QC check at any time whilst in a session.



There could be 2 different flows, I need a confirmation which one to follow from Users perspective.

# A bit of Technical and business process explanation for [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328]  and [~accountid:63b5397e48b367d78a17e89d]. The QC will be done in the same session. Meaning that the stock is not yet added to the stock count  but we can still complete the QC for all the products being receipted. This means that the session will be bound to the QC completion ->
## Product Barcodes will be generated from toolbox with the quantity mentioned. 
## Those barcodes will be pasted on the physical products.
## (Assume that the product we are receipting has been added to the QC enabled list on Toolbox) Then unique QC barcodes will also be generated from Toolbox for same quantity and will be pasted on the physical products along side other barcode.
## Product Barcode will be scanned and quantity will be added and then there will be a button on the top right to do a QC scan and then scanner will be able to scan all the QC barcodes and after scanning there will be an option to select good and bad stock and then another QC barcode could be scanned until all the quantity added for the product has been scanned for QC.
## Then the session could be closed and all the details could be sent over to API server to process and save in the database. Only at this step the stock count is updated and QC will be linked to the stock products.

# Second scenario revolves around the fact that we can still add the product in stock and the QC remains optional for that session but will restrict anyone from allocating that product to order because the QC check is still not completed. What that means, is explained in further steps.
## Product Barcodes will be generated from toolbox with the quantity mentioned. 
## Those barcodes will be pasted on the physical products.
## Product Barcode will be scanned and quantity will be added to the stock count and the session could be closed. There will be a popup saying QC is pending and needs to be completed (Only in case when QC is mandatory).
## (Assume that the product we are receipting has been added to the QC enabled list on Toolbox) Then unique QC barcodes will be generated from Toolbox for mentioned quantity and will be pasted on the physical products along side other barcodes.
##  Then there will be a button on the top right to do a QC scan or maybe another action to do a QC scan and then scanner will be able to scan all the QC barcodes and after scanning there will be an option to select good and bad stock and then another QC barcode could be scanned until all the quantity added for the product has been scanned for the QC.
## The details could be sent over to API server to process and save in the database. This will link the QC to the stock products.



I hope this explanation is clear and gives you a clear view of what’s being asked.
FYI [Project Managers|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/1e1cc803-9b3d-46b2-9ff5-bb596c4affe7?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:712020:fef9c044-2a5c-44a4-a622-ca442785b4f1] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496])

column1: Toolbox - wh_picking_products table not pulling through employee profile_id or team_id
column35:
The wh_picking_products table in toolbox DB is not pulling through the profile_id and team_id for certain products picked. I can’t seem to find a trend on product type or employee type, it just seems to be sporadic. If you look at the same order in Gsit it does however show the product as picked and has an employee assigned to it (screenshot in the example below). 

Attachments: 
  

  [ Screenshot 2024-04-30 at 15.48.53.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/50350  ] - 61700 Bytes - Amardeep Sandhu - 2024-04-30 
  [ Screenshot 2024-04-30 at 15.49.53.png | https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/content/50351  ] - 126117 Bytes - Amardeep Sandhu - 2024-04-30
column55:
# try to replicate but in staging 
# create some jobs in staging 
# scanning to complete jobs it working fine team id and profile id store in wh_picking_product table ;01/Jul/24 7:02 AM;712020:1660b04f-bb59-47f7-b2c1-abbf776455d9;18000
column56:
I have tried to replicate this issue in the Toolbox staging environment. I created a job and scanned the product through the Scanning platform. The process completed and is working fine as expected. It successfully stored the data in the wh_scans table and updated the team_id and profile_id in the wh_picking_products table. I have attached the screenshot.
I checked the live database and found that for product ID "14455421", the wh_scans table is missing the type "pick enters". I believe this is why the profile_id and team_id were not updated.;03/Jul/24 9:51 AM;712020:1660b04f-bb59-47f7-b2c1-abbf776455d9;18000

column510:
03/Jul/24 9:41 AM;712020:1660b04f-bb59-47f7-b2c1-abbf776455d9;Hi [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] 
I have tried to replicate this issue in the Toolbox staging environment. I created a job and scanned the product through the Scanning platform. The process completed and is working fine as expected. It successfully stored the data in the wh_scans table and updated the team_id and profile_id in the wh_picking_products table. I have attached the screenshot.
I checked the live database and found that for product ID "14455421", the wh_scans table is missing the type "pick enters". I believe this is why the profile_id and team_id were not updated.
I tested this on my end and it is working correctly. I have not encountered a scenario where the team_id and profile_id were not updated. I request the QA team to help me find this issue.

FYI [~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328] 
Thanks

column1: Add FAQ page to the website
column35:
Need to pick up and include the home delivery FAQs on the website. 

See below designs:

[https://xd.adobe.com/view/d32a05ed-7e66-444a-a625-e897b246d8d4-8679/|https://xd.adobe.com/view/d32a05ed-7e66-444a-a625-e897b246d8d4-8679/|smart-link] 

See [cms.bjshomedelivery.com/admin|http://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/admin] for the FAQ content management system created already.

*28/5/2024*

*As a* CS Manager,

*I want* the family website to have a FAQ page

*so that* customers can view FAQ content online and reduce the customer service call and SMS volume.

*Acceptance Criteria*
1. This page should include a header section where Help section summary could be provided


!image-20240527-112922.png|width=1307,height=362,alt="image-20240527-112922.png"!

# The user should be able to search through the content using keywords. This should return relevant results.

!image-20240527-114023.png|width=1122,height=354,alt="image-20240527-114023.png"!
# Popular Home delivery  Questions

!image-20240527-113437.png|width=1122,height=118,alt="image-20240527-113437.png"!

# Logo of BJS Home delivery

!image-20240527-113555.png|width=1120,height=108,alt="image-20240527-113555.png"!
# There should be a list of Topics. Each topic tile should contact an icon, Topic Name and a summary. 

_Topic name and summary should come from CMS_


!image-20240527-113632.png|width=1086,height=175,alt="image-20240527-113632.png"!

# Each tile should take the user to a page where they can view a list of questions and answers on selected topic. 

_Questions and answers should come from CMS_


!image-20240527-114115.png|width=50%,alt="image-20240527-114115.png"!



!image-20240527-114312.png|width=1126,height=620,alt="image-20240527-114312.png"!



# The user should be able to switch between the topics from FAQ page
# The user should be able to contact customer service team for any exception questions. This should be available throughout the FAQ pages

column464:
This feature requires development on both the server side and the client side.

h4. Server Side (CMS-Strapi)

# *Data Provision*:
#* Utilize Strapi as the CMS to manage and store FAQ data.
#* Ensure that Strapi endpoints are configured to expose the necessary data for the FAQ page.
#* Implement data uploading functionality for users to input FAQs into Strapi.
# *Custom API Development*:
#* Develop a custom API endpoint to handle search queries.
#* The API should accept input text from the search bar and perform a search on the FAQ data stored in Strapi.
#* Ensure that the API returns results in a structured format suitable for display on the client side.

h4. Client Side

# *FAQ Template Creation*:
#* Develop the main FAQ page template.
#* Implement the following components within the template:
#** *Search Box*:
#*** Create an input field for users to enter search queries.
#*** Ensure the search box is connected to the custom API for real-time search results.
#** *Popular Asked Questions*:
#*** Design a section to display frequently asked questions.
#*** Retrieve this data from Strapi and ensure it updates dynamically as the content changes.
#** *Category-Wise Questions*:
#*** Develop nested components to display questions categorized by topic.
#*** Ensure the categories are dynamically generated based on the data from Strapi.
#*** Implement functionality to allow users to navigate through different categories easily.
# *Client-Server Integration*:
#* Set up API calls from the client side to interact with the Strapi endpoints and the custom search API.
#* Ensure proper data handling and rendering on the client side based on the responses from the server.
#* Implement error handling and loading states to improve user experience.
# *Styling and Responsiveness*:
#* Ensure the design is responsive and works well on various devices and screen sizes.


*CMS Endpoint to Fetch Data:*

These are the primary API endpoints required for integration with the client side to achieve the functionality described above.

* *Custom Search Question Based on Text Input Inside SearchBar:*
** Endpoint: [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/search?questions={text}|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/search?questions={text}]
** Method: GET
** Description: This endpoint facilitates custom search functionality based on text input provided within the search bar as query parameters. It returns relevant questions matching the search query.
*** *Example:* To fetch a question with search input text as *track*, use [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/search?questions=track|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/search?questions=track]
* *Popularly Asked Questions:*
** Endpoint: [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions?popular_question=true|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions?popular_question=true]
** Method: GET
** Description: This endpoint retrieves a list of frequently asked questions (FAQs), providing users with quick access to commonly sought information.

* *Category-wise Questions:*
** Endpoint: [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/categories|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/categories]
** Method: GET
** Description: Facilitates the retrieval of questions categorized according to specific categories.{color:#ffffff}goriescategorie{color}

* *Search Category By ID :*
** Endpoint: [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/categories/{id}|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/categories/{id}]
** Method: GET
** Description: Fetches a specific category by its ID, including the questions associated with that category{color:#ffffff}.{color}
*** *Example:* To fetch a category with ID 36, use [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/categories/36|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/categories/36]

* *Get All Questions* :
** Endpoint: [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions]
** Method: GET
** Description: Facilitates the retrieval of all questions .{color:#ffffff}gor{color}
* *Search Question by ID:*
** Endpoint: [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/{id}|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/{id}]
** Method: GET
** Description: Allows searching for a specific question by its unique identifier (ID). Users can directly access a question using its ID through this endpoint.
*** *Example:* To fetch data of a question with ID 17, use [https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/17|https://cms.bjshomedelivery.com/questions/17]

[Project Managers|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/1e1cc803-9b3d-46b2-9ff5-bb596c4affe7?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]) FYI
column505:
12/Aug/24 11:04 AM;5f16be5e1084620015eb875d;[Project Managers|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/1e1cc803-9b3d-46b2-9ff5-bb596c4affe7?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]) HI,
Alternative Services to Appyway with API Documentation:
1. Inrix - [https://docs.inrix.com/parking/bulk/|https://docs.inrix.com/parking/bulk/|smart-link] 
2. spothero - [https://api.staging.spothero.com/v2/docs|https://api.staging.spothero.com/v2/docs|smart-link] 
3. here -  [https://www.here.com/docs/bundle/off-street-parking-api-developer-guide/page/topics/resource-facilities.html|https://www.here.com/docs/bundle/off-street-parking-api-developer-guide/page/topics/resource-facilities.html|smart-link] 
4. arrive - [https://developer.arrive.com/v4/#price-quotes-and-locations|https://developer.arrive.com/v4/#price-quotes-and-locations|smart-link] 

Other services like Parkopedia, ParkWhiz, ParkMe and BestParking are also available but their API docx. has not been found.

While reviewing these APIs, These APIs are generally more complex than Appyway. 
Most require fetching an auth token first, and providing responses that may not be relevant.

Further research is needed to identify the most suitable API.
column506:
14/Aug/24 11:13 AM;5f16be5e1084620015eb875d;[Project Managers|https://bjsdevteam.atlassian.net/jira/people/team/1e1cc803-9b3d-46b2-9ff5-bb596c4affe7?ref=jira$&src=issue] ([~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496]) Hi,
I have reviewed the API documentation for two services so far:-

*Inrix -* [https://docs.inrix.com/|https://docs.inrix.com/|smart-link] 

* Provides off-street and on-street parking data including real-time, static, and high-accuracy data.
* The API might require a more in-depth understanding when integrating data types (e.g., parking).
* It has a strong presence in North America and Europe.

*APIs:*

* *Bulk:* {{https://daar.parkme.com/v2/{onstreet/offstreet}/{static/dynamic}}}
* *Off-Street (Lots):* {{https://api.parkme.com/lots?accesstoken=$token&point=34.017395736527334|-118.49404245615005&radius=75&locale=en-US}}
* *On-Street (Blocks):* {{https://api.parkme.com/blocks?accesstoken=$token&point=34.017395736527334|-118.49404245615005&radius=50&locale=en-US}}  

-----------------------------------------


*Here -* [https://www.here.com/docs/bundle/off-street-parking-api-developer-guide/page/topics/overview.html|https://www.here.com/docs/bundle/off-street-parking-api-developer-guide/page/topics/overview.html|smart-link] 

* Focuses on off-street parking in structured facilities like garages, offering real-time and accurate data.
* The integration process is straightforward.
* provides global coverage with a particularly strong presence in Europe and North America.

*APIs:*

* *Parking Facilities Search:* {{https://parking-v2.cc.api.here.com/parking/facilities.json?prox=52.51638,13.38244,500}}
Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_TOKEN}
* *Parking Facility Details:* {{https://parking-v2.cc.api.here.com/parking/facilities/276u33db-e63737ae997c4a1ab5a19c50a63af49e.json}}
Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_TOKEN}

-------------------------------------------------


*Arrive/ParkWhiz* - [https://developer.arrive.com/v4/#arrive-api-v4|https://developer.arrive.com/v4/#arrive-api-v4|smart-link] 

* The Arrive API provides real-time information about parking availability & pricing.
* Arrive focuses on reservation-based parking with data sourced directly from parking providers and facility owners.
* Primarily focused on the U.S.

*Recommended APIs:*

- *quotes and Locations*- search for parking price and availablity.  [_https://api.parkwhiz.com/v4/_|https://api.parkwhiz.com/v4/quotes][*quotes*|https://api.parkwhiz.com/v4/quotes]
*- search venues*: /venues
These APIs are recommended for retrieving parking information based on the documentation and additional research.

-------------------------------------------------

*SpotHero -* [https://api.staging.spothero.com/v2/docs|https://api.staging.spothero.com/v2/docs|smart-link] *.  Or* [https://developers.spothero.com/v2.0/reference#apiOverview|https://developers.spothero.com/v2.0/reference#apiOverview|smart-link] 

** Shows real-time availability for parking spots.
** Focuses mainly on major cities in the United States and Canada. They have partnerships with parking garages and lots.
** Best suited for urban areas with dense parking needs, such as downtown areas.
** Focuses on off-street parking.
* 
*API’s*
*parking search*: curl -s -X GET \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer {{access_token}}"  \
    [https://api.spothero.com/v2/search|https://api.spothero.com/v2/search]

*Parking facility search*: [https://api.spothero.com/v2/search/{facility_id}|https://api.spothero.com/v2/search/{facility_id}]

-------------------------------------------------------

column1: Driver Component for TMS
column35:
Driver Component TMS

 

 

h1. +Driver Induction+

Induction for drivers done during a 2-day course.

Assets: 2 Devices/Tablets required for the induction course for the drivers to fill in the information/forms at point of induction and sign on glass.

Admin in charge of this induction will require an course register to confirm attendance.

# Driver’s fill/sign forms which are used to file into the driver profile.

Following forms for the drivers to sign at point of induction:

+*Construct IT*+

·        Absence notification reminder.

·        Health, endorsement & convictions declaration.

·        PPE and Equipment check list form.

·        Fuel Receipt Process.

·        Fuel Card memo to HGV Drivers.

·        Expense Form.

·        Driver Details & Fuel Card Notes.

·        DCPC Training Declaration (Driver certificate of Professional Competence Training Declaration).

·        Davis Induction Memos.

·        Eyesight Sheet.

 

+*Haulage*+

 

·        Davis Induction Form.

·        DCPC Training Declaration – BJS Haulage.

·        Eyesight check form.

·        Health, Endorsements & Convictions Declaration.

·        Absence notification reminder.

·        Defect reporting procedure.

·        Accident reporting procedure.

·        Accident reporting process.

·        BJS waiting Time Process.

·        BJS Pod Process.

·        BJS Site Maps.

·        Fuel Receipt Process.

·        Blank Pod’s.

·        Escalation Process BJS Haulage.

·        Expense Sheet.

·        Fuel Card Memo to HGV Drivers.

 

 

h1. +Driver Registration Details+

 

§  Driver ID – Assigned by us.

§  First, Middle and Surname

§  Address, Town, Postcode

§  Date of Birth – Auto-fill the age based on the input on date of birth.

§  Age

§  Gender

§  Employee Ethnicity

§  Ethnicity Sub

§  Mobile, Home Number

§  Email address.

§  Location (where driver is located). Drop down with the following. Note this should suggest locations based on info inputted and not restricted to the UK only.

§  National Insurance Number

§  Employment Status

§  Start Date and Finish calculator. Continue calculation even after suspension.

§  Probation Period – Begins from Start date for 3 months. Be able to edit probation end day to earlier or later based on driver performance. Highlight to line manager or HR when probation period over so they can review. Sign and upload documents.

§  Hours – 11 Hours daily etc.

§  Agreed Wage – Annual Wage – Tax not included in this.

§  Holiday Entitlement – 20 days plus bank holidays so total of 28 days.

§  Health Check Due reminders.

§  Line Manager

§  Job Type - HGV.

§  Department - Haulage or Construct IT.

§  Job Title (Drop down options).

§  HGV Crane Driver

§  HGV Drawbar

§  HGV Driver

§  HGV Shunter Driver

§  HGV Tipper Driver

§  Health Conditions

§  Tacho Card ID

§  Shift – Drop down with:

# Days.

# Trampers.

# Night Shunter.

# Day Shunter.

# 4 on 4 off Driver.

§  Work Hours – Assigned work hours such as 8:00-11:00AM starts. This is set by us.

§  Status - Active/Suspended/Leaver.

§  Suspender – Date from and to for suspension with number of days.

§  Suspended – Reason for suspension in drop down – Threat to Business or Harm. Be able to upload document for this as well. This is for HR. If driver is suspended, then they should not be showing on router. After suspension, someone will either go back on route or even just be put on probation so need to be able to select probation date. Audit so if they try to log another suspension it shows any priors for this driver.

§  Suspended – Actions to take such as disciplinary in written warning.

§  Leaver – Reason for leaving with the following drop down: Failed Probation, Dismissed, Ill Health and Retired. With documentation to be uploaded. Audit for this as well. Driver to be taken off on the routers etc if on leave.

§  Driver Documentation's such as license, driver cpc, experience etc. This is at point of induction.

h1. HR/Admin – Access Levels.

* Attachment options - Attach documents according to driver on the portal. Make it poss for the driver to view these documents as well.
* Electronic Forms to complete by employee or line manager - prompt an email to HR. Forms such as probation, attach documents to these. Courtney to provide form.
* Payroll Number
* Payroll Monthly/Weekly.
* Hours – such as 11 hours daily etc.
* Agreed Wage – Annual Wage tax not deducted.
* Start Date to Finish Date calculator.
* Leavers - Date, Reason, Notes, Archive Number.
* Holiday Entitlement - Name, BJS ID, Role, Company, Contracted Days, Contracted Hours, PR NUM, Start Date, Hol Entitlement, Days taken to date, own days accured, Overall Days Remaining, Days Currently can take, Under / over entitlement. This to be reflected on router so any driver on holiday will not be shown on there and will be given prompt if attempt to add to route.
* Holiday Calendar for Drivers to view current holidays.
* Right to work
* Type of rights to work
* Origin
* Visa Expiry
* Job type
* Department
* Probation Calendar - From start date to highlight when reached Probation Period with prompt with electronic form sent to Line Manager. Probation end date, outcome , date and notes.
* Training / Qualifications - Employee Name, Payroll No, Department, Training/Quali Details, Provider/Delivered by, Type of training, Gained, Start Date, Expiry (Calendar Prompt for any expiry certifications at least a month prior), Cost, Repayment and notes. Upload documents for proof.
* Employee Compliance - prompts if same problem has been logged as prior.
* Log Incident/Accident/H&S issues according to Driver. Have audit of this.
* Periodic review - Incentive - what basis this works.
* Audit trail and ability to search based on employee and other specifications.
* Disciplinary for drivers - Repeat offenses need to be highlight for HR. Name, BJS ID, Employment status, Dept, Job Type, Job title, Location, Event such as final warning/verbal/first, Issued by, Date Issued, Date Expires, Days to Expire probation period, Status of disciplinary, Notes.
* Bonus Payment calculator / History – Every 6 months bonus given based on Fuel efficiency, Infringement’s (deduct from bonus), at fault accidents (deduct from bonus) and sickness (deduct from bonus).

+*Bonus Payment Calculator Requirements:*+

·        Employee name.

·        BJS ID.

·        Department.

·        Payroll – monthly.

·        Last Bonus Eligibility date (Start date for new starters).

·        Upcoming Bonus Eligibility Date. Date.

·        Upcoming Bonus Payment Day. Date.

·        Total Damage cost – Drop down with:

# BJS Haulage - £374 or less.

# BJS Haulage - £375 to £749.

# BJS Haulage - £750+.

# Awaiting Information.

# Construct IT - £624 or less.

# Construct IT - £625 to £999.

# Construct IT - £1000+.

·        Damage payment due – Digit’s only.

·        Eco Driving Score

# Awaiting Information.

# BJS Haulage – 9+.

# BJS Haulage – 8.5 to 8.9.

# BJS Haulage – 8 to 8.4.

# BJS Haulage – 7.9 or less.

# Construct IT – 8+.

# Construct IT – 7.5 to 7.9.

# Construct IT – 7 to 7.4.

# Construct IT – 6.9 or less.

·        EDS Payment Due.

·        Disciplinary Action:

# Yes. – automatically inputs the Disciplinary deduction (%) to 0.10.

# No.

# Awaiting information.

·        Disciplinary Deduction (%).

·        Absence:

# Yes. Auto inputs 0.50 in the Absence Deduction (%).

# No.

# Awaiting Information.

·        Absence Deduction (%).

·        Payment total.

·        Deduction total (%).

·        Deduction total (£).

·        Amount Payable (£).

+*Disciplinary:*+

·        Name.

·        BJS ID.

·        Reason for Disciplinary – free form text.

·        Employment Status. – Leaver or Employed.

·        Department – Haulage / Construct IT.

·        Job Type – HGV Driver. Drop down.

·        Job Title – drop with:

# Aiden Swanson.

# HGV Crane Driver.

# HGV Drawbar Crane Driver.

# HGV Driver.

# HGV Tipper Driver.

# HGV Tramper Driver.

# Shunter.

# Shunter Driver.

·        Location – Wednesbury or remote.

·        Event – drop down with:

# Dismissed.

# Extension to Final Warning.

# Extension to First Warning.

# File note.

# Final Warning.

# First Warning.

# No Sanction Given.

# Resigned During Disciplinary.

# Verbal warning.

·        Issued by – Manager name etc.

·        Date issued.

·        Date Expires – reminder for this.

·        Days to expiry – calculation based on days.

·        Status – Active and Expired.

·        Notes – Additional information.



 

 

h1. +Agency Driver’s+

 

·        Agency dashboards required.

·        Portal access to work both ways. Request number of drivers and the agency provide confirmation of the driver with license, contact details etc. Currently, request sent via email or phone call.

·        Agency performance / banned drivers list.

Agency List:

·        Best Connection

·        Modern Edge

·        Work Chain

·        Nel

·        Proactive

·        Temp Source

·        Pure Staff

·        I Recruit

·        Mainstay

·        The Recruiting Co

+*On Day of Route*+

 

The following checks need to be completed for agency drivers on day of route.

·        Date – Route date.

·        Time – Route start time

·        Actual Arrival time of Driver – what time the driver arrived to collect keys information etc.

·        Agency Name

·        Driver Name

·        Duty – Haulage or Construct IT job.

·        Contact number – of the driver.

·        Keys handed over – Y/N

·        Vehicle Reg

·        Trailer

·        License Checked – Y/N.

·        Driver Declaration

·        Driver Agreement Paye.

·        Allocated Fuel Card – Y/N. If yes then input fuel card number.

·        Agency phone / charge – ID and number of the phone.

·        Allocated Anderson Lead

·        Allocate HI-VIZ – Agency drivers will bring their own but if agency driver does ask for one then they should input this as yes for us to receive it back end of day.

·        Brief completed by – who completed the above information.

+*Driver App for Agency Drivers*+

 

·        Log in with unique id based on agency. Driver name, photo of license and photo of driver live time.

·        Be able to log defects/ walkaround etc.

·        Contact us regarding any concerns or report any issues.

·        Full view of the route ahead.

The agency driver should not be able to view sensitive information such as contracts etc. Should only be able to do walkarounds, report on road issues etc.

 

+*End of route checks*+

 

·        All assets returned. Y/N

·        Card Downloaded Y/N

·        Infringements Y/N

·        Debrief completed by.

 

 

+*Agency Driver – Assets*+

 

Fuel Cards for agency drivers are provided which must be handed back at end of day. If the team were to fuel up on route, they will need to take images of odometer and fuel etc with images of receipt on driver app.

 

+*Agency Ban List*+

 

This is a list of drivers who have been banned due to certain reasons such as damage, slow/lost, attitude, no show’s, failure to report damages, poor English or previously employed with us and wrote off car.

This list will have the following information for the driver:

·        Agency

·        Driver Name

·        Reason

 

If any driver is allocated to this list, they should not be allowed on route in the future as well.

column1: Carrier changed from Direct Deliveries to BJS Extra
column35:
for order B6792234-7779, the carrier was changed to Direct Deliveries on 05/03 
on 07/03, agent added '07/03- TOCK NOT REC'D -reported ' into order status notes, and when he saved the coms, the carrier automatically changed back to BJS Extra 

another example is order B6768587-7285
when you save coms in order status notes, the carrier for some reason changes back to BJS Extra  

Attachments:
column502:
13/Mar/24 10:40 AM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;*Sanchit Aggarwal added:*
[~accountid:62a71e93d0132d00687f47de] 

I have investigated this and replicated the issue on Staging too, 
This is happening due to lack of implementation of {{OwnerID}} and {{ClientID}} concept under Sub-Contractors, which we do have in case of Orders. 

*Replication steps are:*

# Create an Order on GSiT Extra and update the Carrier to BJS Home Delivery.
# Transfer the Order On GSiT Home Delivery portal.
# Now update the Carrier on Home Delivery portal to {{Direct Deliveries NI}} or any other available. 
# Reopen the Same order on GSiT Extra, you will notice that the Carrier on Extra portal is displaying BJS Extra. 
# After this if user make any other changes like saving notes, updating contact on extra portal, then extra’s subcontractor ID will get passed and updated. 



*This needs to be raised with GSiT!*

FYV [~accountid:62f27b38da8620d533948496] [~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728] [~accountid:557058:f6fc8480-85b5-4054-976e-bf34bae250d1]

column1: SSO | Suggestion | Department add change through perimeter UI
column35:
A department can be added or changed by the team leads or those who have permission to change through the perimeter/SSO UI.

Currently, the SD team contacts developers to update their department from SSO. These changes include department_id and legacy_id which are linked with GSIT and Twilio flex.
column420:
As an SD team member, 
I want to change departments and add departments to existing users and new users according to their needs or team needs from SSO/Perimeter UI.
This will help the SD team and it will save time.
column464: *Only those Who have permission can change the department.*

column1: 1 - Labels taking too long to load on Toolbox (recent imports)
column35:
When we import a manifest onto GSIT, we send PDF labels from toolbox to the clients. It is taking a very long time for the import to update on toolbox (recent imports). We are having to keep refreshing the page and it is very time consuming

column1: Suggestion- Need option to edit postcode under Collection slot dashboard.
column35:
Need option to edit postcode under Collection slot dashboard. 

As the entries will be created by users manually, there will be chances that the user might can add an incorrect postcode. 

In that case, we would require an Edit postcode functionality, otherwise, user will have to create another record with correct postcode, and unnecessarily incorrect data will be stored in backend, which will never be used.

column1: Suggestion- Update the EDIT modal on Time Slot module, so user can update slots at a single click for selected postcode
column35:
Update the EDIT modal on Time Slot module, so user can update slots at a single click for selected postcode

Currently if for a client, i want to update Slots for full week, then i have to update it one by one for each day. 
Which is increasing the number of user clicks and consume time. 

So to make it efficient, Can we update the Edit modal menu similar to Add postcode?
So user will have to click on edit button once, and can update the Schedule for whole week?

column328: Epod bugs 2024
column415:
I have checked this issue, this issue first occur in december 2023,
As per my finding, this could be possible due to internal package PyJWT package has automatically updated as we haven't mentioned exact version in the requirements.txt file, so this might be the chance.or,
we need to check pycrypto package version which is currently installed, might the cause of updated.
attached screenshot below.
this is the new way to import SHA256

{noformat}from Crypto.Hash import SHA256{noformat}

in the error:

{noformat}import Crypto.Hash.SHA256{noformat}

Possible solution:
If we can somehow know, what are the version of dependencies earlier is installed, then we can compare them.

# we can also do that same in local, by reconfigure everything for epod. then checking by importing the module in terminal.
# we can check pycrypto version if installed, or pycryptodome, PyJWT. then match with updated packages.

column502:
01/Feb/24 2:15 PM;712020:40fd1585-f7c4-4ca9-8e53-63c2830ba4a6;Hi
Here is some finding I found during R&D 

To integrate shipping integration linnworks, I found 11 action on which we can perform operations, the actions are listed as follows:

# AddNewUserEndpoint:- Create new Integration for user and default configuration profile for the integration
2.UserConfig:- Gets the current stage of user config. The service method returns current stage of the config, description, title and config items the user has to enter. Linnworks will then render config items on UI(Linnworks platform integration wizard) and on submiting the form on UI linnworks will send the information to UpdateConfig endpoint.
# UpdateConfig:- Update integration profile config stage with values entered by the user.
# ConfigDelete:- Method is called when the user deletes the integration in [http://linnworks.net|http://linnworks.net|smart-link]  
# UserAvailableServices: Returns a list of available services for a given integration profile.
# ExtendedPropertyMapping: Get the list of extended property mapping values.
# GenerateLable: This action will send a consignment request which contains the shipping address, list of packages and shipping service configuration options. This action will generate a label for each package and return all packages with the matching sequence number.
# CancelLabel:- Cancels all labels for the consignment by OrderId.
# CreateManifest:- This action is called by linnworks when a user files a manifest. The request will contain all order Id to be manifested (filed as the end of day)

Concerns:-

# How BJS will work with linnworks? accordingly we need to create application structure So I need clear picture of flow that how BJS will be collaborating with linnworks.
# I don't understand the Point of contact where we will transfer orders from linnworks to BJS system.

FYI[~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328]

Following are the api we have to consume once we got store onaboarded on e-comm.

column1: Toolbox- Customer Return order products are not visible under the loading sheet under Loading Old dashboard.
column35:
Customer Return order products are not visible under the loading sheet under Loading Old dashboard. 
On scanning if a return order is allocated to order then the Return type products linked to that order is visible and scannable. 
but when we check the loading sheet for same route. Then the return type products which were linked to return order are not visible, 

due to which in case if delivery team is not able to locate the product in van, then DH team will not be able to help the delivery team, as they use loading sheet to help delivery team in such case.

column1: Enhance SSO multi agent organisation | triage | support BJS Router
column35:
Enhance SSO multi agent organisation | triage | support BJS Router

*Workflow Diagram as follows:*

!Screenshot 2023-09-08 at 2.40.53 PM.png|width=100%!

*User Case:*

*notation:* Organisation === client

Establish many-to-one relation between *SSO user* base with (new scheme entity organisation) *org_id* at perimeter. Update auth claim to accommodate org_id across the micro services while provided token. 

Micro-services extract *org_id* from claim and modifies ORM queries to retrieve organisation based data e.g in Optimiser Orders, Routes and API cache configs. Route designers will get switch account feature to consume organisation based data to do regular actions, Design routes and send back to organisation account at GSIT.

*Expected Goal:*

Convert Routing platform to an Intermediate product as service sitting between delivery owners(*clients*) and delivery carriers (*clients*) and routing agents utilise route optimisation skills based on clients configurations.

*Note:* Agents (*Internal or External*) switch accounts permissions handled by watchman micro-service. All source data coming from GSIT irrespective of client based check.

column1: Toolbox :: s3 Archive handling
column35:
To cover the s3 archive functionality, we have to cover it in two phases

*Frontend:-* As we have two types of interface in toolbox to show resources under which we have to handle s3 archive thing.

* First one is normal, where image is placed standalone without any cosmetic touch
* Second one is slider, where images are displaying under slider with auto & manual scrolling

In the both cases, before rendering the image we have to check the response of s3 end-point and show a image with water-mark text “Request to Archive“. To confirm the broken image needs for request to archive from API, please check with {{Error}} > {{StorageClass}} key with value ({{StorageClass}} shouldn’t be empty). Please check the below screenshot for the same.

!image-20230629-133454.png|width=770,height=135!

*Backend:-* When user hit on image with watermark text, we have to ask for confirmation for restore process

!image.png|width=656,height=158!

Once confirmed, we have to ask for confirmation with number of days (which depicts the life of resource and its required). 

!image (1).png|width=660,height=246!

If user try to restore the request resource again, we have to show a prompt with message “Restore already in progress, wait or check on AWS console“

Once confirmed, we have to show a success prompt with message “Object restore request is initiated“. 

To restore the resource, we have to hit an EPOD end-point which controls our request for s3 bucket to restore the requested resource.

*Toolbox dashboards for actions:-*

# Offload >> Offload Dashboard (New)
# S3 resources
# Vehicle check Outbound/Inbound
# Vehicle Defect Report
# Vehicle Report

https://epod.staging.bjshomedelivery.com/get_attached_file/*97396*

column504:
04/Jul/23 9:19 AM;6188eabb137a51006a374287;[~accountid:61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328] Yes, I agree with you. We can’t move with existing API logic, as its working with table primary key of EPOD database. 

We need to handle this with image name, which must be in array as parameter, so that we can send the images in single go to confirm the archive status. 

Please raise a ticket as API blocker for EPOD team and co-ordinate with them, if they need.
column505:
04/Jul/23 12:55 PM;61d55d3fe67ea2006bd5c328;[~accountid:6188eabb137a51006a374287] 
EPOD S3 archive policy only impacts EPOD related s3 buckets. 

For example-

* Production EPOD: deals with “bjsdelapp“ s3 bucket
* Staging EPOD: deals with “bjs-epod-staging“ bucket
* Development EPOD: deals with “bjs-epod-development“ bucket

There is no impact on the toolbox s3 buckets.

In the above task description, you mentioned that

*Toolbox dashboards for actions:-*

# Offload >> Offload Dashboard (New) *=> S3 archive impact because we are using the EPOD API endpoint*   
# S3 resources *=> S3 archive impact because we are using the EPOD API endpoint*
# Vehicle check Outbound/Inbound *=> No impact because are using the toolbox s3 bucket*
# Vehicle Defect Report *=> No impact because are using the toolbox s3 bucket “toolbox-live“*
# Vehicle Report *=> No impact because are using the toolbox s3 bucket “toolbox-live“*



As I have checked with [~accountid:63bbe492df0fa548e8e83d61]  on the EPOD dashboard, 

* They are showing the thumbnail of the images
* Once click on it then they are fetching the original image from the s3 bucket 
* If an image is found achieved then they are making the request to restore the archived image.

Please have a look and update the requirement accordingly. 

FYI: [~accountid:62820c77c217e200698b7763] [~accountid:63bbe492df0fa548e8e83d61] 

Thanks

column1: 1-Whatsapp for DH: Update Toolbox to request comms through WhatsApp
column35:
Harry Bhaaji has said we may not work on the DH flow just yet (this depends on whether there are enough features available in WhatsApp for business to enable a good experience for drivers) however - if we do go ahead then:

1. We will set up new templates for driver availability and route confirmation

2. We will set up a new template for CC to request “images + additional details” for complaints
3. Toolbox will need to call switchboard to send out these business initiated conversations (BICs) to the recipients

4. We’ll need to update the Twilio flows to handle the responses inbound from these templated messages.





We will have to determine if this is going ahead straight away or happening later as the business decides!
column420:
Need to consider the below points:
We will not show the contact details, images of customer to delivery team.
Will not provide a option to calls on WhatsApp.
column464:
*we will set up a new template for CC to Request “images+ additional details” for complaints*
Not purely for DH
Current process for CC to request images: for driver side they retrieve pictures from EPOD. In case when no pictures available and there are notes in GSIT notes- check images in WhatsApp group.
CC passed a complaint to DC- and they ask from drivers. Sometimes they do recall those things, sometimes they don't…DH team will have to remember that this was the delivery. If they can help us resolve that complaint, send some pictures in order to recall them.

* 90 percent job of cc to investigate a problem. Then change the status to DCI.DCI is DH Complaint. For every complaint it is mandatory to put the team at fault or not at fault. They go to their profile on toolbox. And they dh send back to CCI and then they make the first decision and send it to the client.
Sometimes due to the network they click pictures on their personal phones.
* If we click any pics from their personal number. They attached orders as well.
* Complaints on route: Property damage, item damage, service not fulfilled. Try to solve complaints the same day. But after 4.00 clock keep for next day. The current process is not easy.you need to scroll up to find the image.


* *It could be sometime when we are busy .Then the team can send us a msg,.That would be automated.*
* *WhatsApp recorded conversation. No fear of losing conversation. When agents are busy they can put a msg. When agent free, they can pick it up*
* Now they are supposed to ,msg in a WhatsApp group. Chances to miss that. If we have a WhatsApp task that can be picked up. No chances to miss. Or *not require a call just put a msg*
* *Sometimes drop 24 tells you, there was a service refusal at drop 2.there was an assembly issue at drop 5.sometime they don't call on every drop.*
* We can't tell drivers to go back and fix that. Because they have other orders to deliver.



* FOR THIS - THEN THEY HAVE TO PUT A MSG LIKE CUSTOMER REFUSED THE SERVICE , THEN WE CAN CONFIRM WITH CUSTOMER
*BENEFITS:*
* On performance basis: it's gonna support: Now who's speaking on WhatsApp app hoc requests, that’s not recorded. We will have a report how many WhatsApp queries we picked/solved. How many outgoing calls did they make?



* They call the office to tell something . they can tell on WhatsApp to save time- then can confirm from customer



* This will make drivers feel a bit more hard and get rid of some of their complaints about phone lines not answered.

Customer service will brilliant , and complaints are much more effective and understandable.

column508:
01/Jun/23 2:45 PM;62820c77c217e200698b7763;[~accountid:629dcd81d442e60068403728]  Impacts are already has been discussed in the attached conversation. It will not affect the current ongoing business, as we are targeting to archive only older data which is not accessed any more by end users. As data is growing daily, storing cost is also increasing as well. We are trying to implementing the solution on service from which a archive policy can be created and files can be restore from same service itself. This will benefit in future alot in managing data and its cost of storage.
We are focusing on data to archive which is older than 1 year or any days(which is suitable for business need). This older data is very rarely accessible by teams. We are unnecessarily paying for this data. If in any rare case this will get accessed then we have restore function in place.


This implementing has been in process on Epod. But in next we will take it to more services like toolbox. We need to make it live fast from here. We will make it live after full testing only. Now we have implemented on epod staging and sent it for testing. We are getting bugs and we are only trying to solving those.

Yes Toolbox Image use case is issue but when it would come if we archive recent data but we this way we will not use this feature. This was done within deadlines given by devops team. Regarding engineering implementations, i discussed this in details with both devops and epod team and what discussed they had implemented same way. regarding documentations yes we did it already, Workflow i shared earlier with teams. Only missing peace is if image archived from EPOD , then if someone trying to see that same image on toolbox then it will show error, because toolbox also reading that same bucket where epod data stored. This was implemented in 2018 to leverage epods data content to show transport team. 

During the development time, I did say to Rakshit to touch base with toolbox team and finish the workflow but that was pending , we know this use case since binging of this feature. But that hasn’t been implement from toolbox side.

This release has been pending from January and waiting to test and release this with 1 year old data. In this use case this shouldn’t be a problem for business but when testing team raised this again Toolbox team agreed to finish this workflow because that time we postponed release due to testing wasn’t performed. So we thought meanwhile we can also finish this side by side and deliver complete feature.

Last month i had discussed with Toolbox team with Manav. As we discussed last time, He was doing some analysis and going to assign to team for development. if this been promised then why again issue raised , are we not going to implement this ?

After two weeks later, some concerns raised on email, what is blocking to toolbox team to implement this. If API isn’t there so EPOD team can develop this and then can work together ( If we are aiming to complete this otherwise still we can go live with 1 year old data).

Now coming to questions raised by team . 

Are we really trying to solve the problem or increasing problems for us without understanding the problem and efforts done to achieve this ? 

I would be very happy if team could try to find out what is missing there to release rather than pointing questions or need to take appropriate actions ? Even I am also not happy with this. We are here to solve the problems. I am here to help if someone facing the difficulties to achieve something. 

I am happy to discuss this on call as well.

Thanks

column35:
The old load dashboard - viewing a load job needs to be updated to contain/display return products allowed to the load job. 

[https://toolbox.bjshomedelivery.com/toolbox-ng/dist/#/warehouse/loading|https://toolbox.bjshomedelivery.com/toolbox-ng/dist/#/warehouse/loading|smart-link]
column420:
*As a* Warehouse Administrator

*I want* to display all return products that will be loaded onto a LGV vehicle

*So that* I can prevent misplacement of return products and stop mis-deliveries

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

# When viewing a load job, any return product allocated to the load job should be displayed within the '(XX) Orders' modal, the following columns within the below image should be populated with the return product and order details, (same format and information should be populated for when a deliver product and order details have been allocated to a load job). 
## Add the return reason and action of the return product, this should be displayed at the bottom of the product information.
## The row containing the return product should update in colour according to its status (same for when a deliver product has been updated).
### Loaded - Green.
### Pending Loading - White.
### Exception (Non-fit) - Yellow.

!image-20230215-140838.png|width=96.03960396039604%!


# Selecting a Return product should expand/collapse and display the timestamps for when a return product had been updated, _the format should be same for when a deliver product has been_ updated _(format consists of the following, (Product Status) + (hh/mm/ss) + (dd/mm/yyyy))_.

!image-20230215-141724.png|width=416,height=164!


# All of the load job statistics counts should be updated (where applicable to do so) to include any return products that are allocated to the load job, _i.e., Non-fit statistic count is 0, a return product has been classed as a ‘non-fit', the statistic count 'Non-fit’ should now display 1_.

!image-20230215-140940.png|width=89.68646864686468%!

column420:
*As a* Warehouse Operative

*I want* to scan return products via the loading interface

*So that* I can prevent mis-deliveries and misplacing returns products from occurring

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

Scanning Interface → Loading

After starting a load job and the user has scanned the vehicle barcode or the loading bay. 

# Display any return product type that has been allocated to route via a return order (ReturnID value in the OrderProducts table). 
# The return product should the exact same information as the deliver product type, (if unsure, refer to the below deliver product type image from an example load job).
# A return product type should display the following when displayed, (can refer to the below image for formatting).
## Drop number.
## Last scanned location. 
## Product Code. 
## Product Description. 
## Part number. 
## Client. 
## Recipient. 
## Recipient Postcode. 
## Barcode.
## {color:#0747a6}Return Destination{color}

!image-20230213-095919.png|width=73.01980198019803%!
_Chromecast_
!image-20230213-100147.png|width=351,height=93!
_Scanners_
# The same process for scanning a deliver product type via Loading should occur to Return product types also, i.e., scanned a return product that was pending loading, this was now scanned and had changed colour to green etc. 
# Scanning a pending return product should move the return product into a loaded state. 
## The status of the return product should also be updated against the load job on the loading dashboard on Toolbox. 
# Scanning a loaded product should prompt the user to confirm if the return product is a non-fit. 
## If the return product has been scanned as a non-fit, list this as an exception within the new loading dashboard against the load job created on Toolbox
# Scanning a non-fit return product should move the product back into a loaded state. 
# Any product scans updates should be listed against the product scans section within a product against the order on GSiT.

*Any updates made to a return product should then be reflected against the product within the load job on the loading dashboard on Toolbox.*

column561: Warehouse - Returns Process

column1: Warehouse - Returns Process
column35: Warehouse have been picking, pre-loading and loading returns with deliver products, this in return is causing the teams to switch to manual process as the scanners do not pick these products up during all three actions.
column262:
* We remove the manual process from the normal picking, pre-loading and loading interfaces for a return product.
* Automating the process allows the teams to be more efficient, save time and stop misplacing products.
column400:
Returns are being sent via the LGV back to the client however the manual process is causing the following. 

* Returns not visible via the normal pick job, causing them to use both (manual & automated) processes at once. 
* Pre-load doesn’t contain the return products which causes them to use automated and manual process for the same route on this feature.
* Loading doesn’t contain the return products which causes them to use automated and manual process for the same route on this feature. 

Using both processes for the same job causes the following. 

* Time loss, as the teams are performing the manual process.
* Products being misplaced/missing as they’re not being loaded and no one knows where their last location was. 
* Mis-deliveries, due to the returns being allocated to a route but are not being sent for delivery, this then causes issues with the client.
column420:
The following changes are required. 

* Scanning - Picking.
* Scanning - Pre-load.
* Scanning - Loading. 
* Toolbox - Standard Picking.
* Toolbox - Loading.
* API - Picking, Pre-load, Loading.
